loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man of 36 years with five children. He earns from selling produce and farming in Kagadi, Uganda. He started farming in 2008.

He is hopeful for his business growth due to the fact that he is hardworking, despite being challenged by competition.

Hassan is requesting a loan to buy a machine to aid him in the maize harvest.

loans.use: to buy a machine to aid him in the maize harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school expenses such as uniforms, school supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a resident of Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has six children. Marissa earns an income through her hog raising business. This 41-year-old, businesswoman has raised pigs for more than three years now.  

Marissa is requesting to avail a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.  A loan is all she needs to improve her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda, 38, is a married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She has six children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is 1. She makes a living through her hog raising business. Glenda has raised pigs for more than two years now. 

Glenda would like to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business. In the future, Glenda dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of 5 children, Maribeth works hard to support her family.

Maribeth has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling livestock. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Maribeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mechail

texts.en:
Mechail is 24 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Mechail has been raising livestock for four years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward saving money to attain her dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
The above picture presents to you Alfred. He is a progressive, smallholder, mixed-farmer in Kenya. He comes from the luxuriant, white highlands of Kericho, an area known for tea production and dairy farming. Alfred owns a fertile, two-acre piece of land in this lush region of Kenya. On the land, he keeps dairy cattle, and grows maize and tea. He gets a lot of support from his dear wife. 

Being a father of a large family comes with lots of responsibility and feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work, so Alfred has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of his family. Alfred started farming just after finishing high school. Since he never advanced his education, and because of the high unemployment rate, he ventured into farming.  He has never regretted this because of the profits he has been making. Alfred practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardworking farmers in his village, because he is able to juggle between keeping dairy cows and also doing crop farming. 

Alfred is a visionary and enterprising person, and has always wanted to do dairy farming in large scale, but one of the challenges he has faced is lack of enough capital. That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Through the loan Alfred is confident that his life will be transformed, and his dream of providing a secure future for his children will be achieved. Alfred is relieved to know that his life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders, who help small scale and aspiring men such as him. Your help will be very important, because people from such remote villages have very limited support.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hardworking entrepreneur with 3 children. She is 46 years old, and 2 of her children are in school.

Corazon has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Corazon has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ruth has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional equipment to use in her business.

Ruth has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment to use in her business

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Crisanta works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Crisanta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Crisanta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.en:
Betsy is 41 years old and is married with 4 children. With all 4 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Betsy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Betsy has been running her business for 14 years now. 

In the future, Betsy would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jamleck

texts.en:
Smallholder farmers in Kenya, like Jamleck (pictured), continue to languish in poverty due to the unwilling nature of formal financial institutions to set up shops in remote areas. They say the rural population is unevenly dispersed, and the farmers make low incomes, irregularly. Supported by Kiva, Juhudi Kilimo penetrates remote regions to finance agricultural assets and farm inputs to improve productivity and profitability of rural enterprises. 

In this case, Jamleck is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase potatoes and beans to grow and harvest on his horticultural farm. He will also use the money to buy pesticide to ensure that his crops are not attacked by bugs predominating the farms in the area. Income from this venture will help Jamleck repay the loan, take care of his wife, and take his children to school. Jamleck's family will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their kind hearts, to spare their needs and help Jamleck raise money to move his family forward.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, beans, and pesticide for his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Myline

texts.en:
Myline is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Myline has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Myline would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mikairi

texts.en: Mikairi is a 32-year-old married father of three children living in Kasese Uganda. Mikairi is a coffee dealer. He also operates a salon business to get additional income. He has a dream of educating his children to attain a minimum qualification. However, he is faced with a challenge of seasonality factors which hinder his business growth and development. Mikairi will use the loan to buy coffee from farmers for selling.

loans.use: to buy coffee from farmers for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines for sewing jeans and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay enrollment fees and university tuition.

loans.name: Flavia Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Flavia Argentina, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, labora como técnico quirúrgico en uno de los centros hospitalarios de la Ciudad de León desde hace veintisiete años, inicia sus labores en horarios rotativos de lunes a domingo, ella realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Doña Flavia, solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de perlín, zinc, bloques, hierro, bloques, cemento, arena y piedrín para la construcción de su humilde vivienda, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Flavia Argentina is a single mother of three children. She works as a surgical technician at one of the central hospitals in the city of León. She has been at this job for 27 years. Flavia works Monday through Sunday on a rotating shift schedule. She works at this job in order to sustain her household.

Doña Flavia is requesting this loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy beams, zinc sheets, blocks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel for the construction of her modest home. This will improve her standard of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beams, zinc sheets, blocks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel for the construction of her home.

loans.name: Eveling De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La joven Eveling de los Ángeles, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, labora como docente en uno de los centros educativos de la Ciudad de León desde hace ocho años, inicia sus labores desde las 06:30 am finalizando a las 12:00 pm de lunes a viernes, ella realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

La Joven Eveling, solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de bloques, hierro,cemento, arena y piedrín para la mejora de su humilde vivienda, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Eveling de Los Ángeles is a young single mother with three children. She works as a teacher at one of the central schools in the city of León. Eveling has been at this job for eight years. She begins her work at 6:30 A.M. and finishes at 12:00 P.M., Monday through Friday. Eveling works at this job in order to sustain her household.

She is requesting this loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy blocks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel so that she can make improvements to her modest home. This will improve her standard of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel so that she can make home improvements.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martín es un hombre de 53 años de edad que se gana la vida desde hace 15 años, con una pequeña tienda de productos básicos la cual instalo en su vivienda a falta de oportunidades de trabajo, pero en la cual le ha ido muy bien y ha logrado mantenerla en el gusto de sus clientes. Él vive con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 21, 20 y 16 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindarle un lugar donde vivir a su familia. Martín desea invertir en su negocio ya que en época navideña las ventas incrementan por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, leche, café, maíz, etc., para seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Martín is a 53-year-old man who has earned his living for 15 years with a little store that sells basic products. He set it up in his home due to the lack of work opportunities. But it has gone very well for him, and he has managed to maintain the satisfaction of his customers. 

He has lived with his life companion and their three children, ages 21, 20, and 16, in his own house for many years. For this reason, he feels happy to be able to offer his family a place to live. Martin wants to invest in his business, since in the Christmas season the sales increase, and so he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in beans, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, corn, etc., to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to invest in beans, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, corn, etc., for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, soap, candies, sodas, coffee, eggs, sweet bread, and seasonal products.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 54 year old married woman and a sari-sari store owner. She resides in Leyte, Philippines. Maribel has operated her sari-sari or variety store for more than 10 years now.

Maribel is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments, bread, candies, snack foods and other items.

Maribel believes that a loan will help her improve her store’s inventory thus attracting more buyers to her store. Maribel has hopes of making her business a sustainable and profitable one.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments, bread, candies, snack foods and other items to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 49-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Angelita has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional dry goods like bags, pants, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell to her customers.

Angelita has been in this business for 27 years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bags, pants, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sherlie

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Sherlie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Sherlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 48 years old and married. She has five children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock to raise.

Rosalina has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business. Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
Avita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a plastic bag making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Avita has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 42 years old, married and has six children, five currently in school.

Sandra is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sandra requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sandra has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sandra would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Elisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Carolyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines and earns additional income from a manicure/pedicure service. Carolyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Carolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is 26 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. Celeste is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Celeste has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cerila has a rug making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Cerila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cerila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 51-year-old married mother of six children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evangeline has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for six years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 51 years old and married with nine children.  With three children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of goods to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old, she has a partner, and they live with their 4 children in the outskirts of Mbarara located in the western region of Uganda. The main activities in this district are agriculture and livestock.

Ruth's occupation is the sale of groceries such as rice, sugar, corn flour, and sodas, among others. Her business is located in her home. She has more than 5 years of experience in this business, and she has loyal clients who give her very good personal and professional references. Additionally, she works in the sale of animals such as goats and sheep, among others. 

Ruth will use her credit to purchase a large quantity of products such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil to increase the stock in her business. 

In this way, Ruth hopes to offer a larger variety of products to her clients, which will allow her to increase her income and, therefore, improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy daily household items for resale.

loans.name: Khareen

texts.en:
Khareen is 36 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Khareen works very hard to provide for them.

Khareen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, groceries, etc.

In the future, Khareen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma: Es una señora luchadora, tiene 66 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad. Su esposo es jubilado con un bajo ingreso que no cubre la mayor parte de las necesidades básicas del hogar. Desde hace 13 años estableció una pequeña pulpería para asegurar un ingreso seguro y atender las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más producto para su negocio: granos básicos, chiverías, sopas instantáneas, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento) porque es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en:
Irma is a determined woman who is 66 years old, married, and has three grown children. Her husband is retired and receives a small pension that does not cover most of their basic household needs.

Thirteen years ago, Irma opened a small grocery store in order to secure a steady income so that they could meet their basic household needs. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more products for her business such as basic grains, yogurts, instant soups, sodas, and other products. Her dream is to have a concrete house because it is more durable.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, yogurts, instant soups, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Anna, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman who hails from Nandi Hills area of Kenya, an area that is near the famous Rift valley. She is 46 years of age and has been farming for the past eight years. Through those years, she has gathered so much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet. Anna is very passionate about farming and she loves cultivating her farm. That is why every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. 

Although Anna makes profits through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income through the selling of cereals. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals. The Nandi Hills area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals. That means that Anna will make more profits and be able to satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Anna, but she feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Anna believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals.  She believes that the extra income will allow permanent change to her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Anna to repay the loan, and secure the future of her school going children. Lenders, if there is someone you should invest in, then it is Anna.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Rabah

texts.en:
Rabah is a 27-year-old, married man.  He has had a mobile phone shop for six years where he sells and repairs cell phones to satisfy his family's needs. He is a hardworking and ambitious man who has a good reputation among his customers.

Rabah is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop his business by increasing his merchandise of spare parts and cell phones. This will facilitate his business and satisfy his customers' needs. Rabah hopes to expand his business in the future, to stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise of spare parts and cell phones.

loans.name: Jennifer Lisseth

texts.es: Jennifer es una mujer de 22 años de edad desde hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos actividad en la que se ha apoyado para poder sacar adelante a su familia y tratar de darles todo lo que está en sus manos para mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad la cual es su mayor alegría y la razón de tanto esfuerzo. Jennifer desea invertir en pollo y gallinas ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y estos forman parte del menú de las fiestas, por lo que espera que sus ventas incrementen en los próximos días, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, gallinas, concentrado y vitaminas y de esta manera contar con una buena cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a woman of 22 years of age. For two years she has raised and sold chickens, a business in which she has supported herself in order to be able to raise her family and try to give them everything that she can to improve their quality of life. She lives with her life companion and their little 4-year-old daughter, who is her greatest joy and the reason for so much effort. 

Jennifer wants to invest in chickens and hens, since the Christmas season is approaching and these form part of the holiday menus. For this reason, she hopes that her sales will increase in the coming days, and so she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in chickens, hens, food concentrate, and vitamins and in this way to have a good quantity of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, hens, food concentrate, and vitamins.

loans.name: Donabella

texts.en:
Donabella is a 59-year-old married woman and a sari-sari store owner residing in Leyte, Philippines. She is the mother of two grown children.

Donabella has operated her sari-sari (variety store) for more than two years now. Her husband works as a farmer.

She is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread, candies and snack foods, and others.

This loan will enable her to improve her available merchandise, thus attracting more buyers into her store. Donabella dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like hot dogs, etc. for her business.

Anita has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like hot dogs, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling native bags in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for making native bags, for her business making and selling native bags.

Vicky successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Vicky's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business weaving native bags

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 56-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a business selling native bags in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more native bags to offer for sale.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. Her goal is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more native bags to offer for sale.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Corazon has been in this business for 12 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 61 years old and married with one child. Clara works very hard to provide for her family.

Clara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, beverages, and groceries.

Clara has been in this business for 12 years now. 

In the future, Clara would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
As a widow mother of three children, Deborah works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a house rental.  Deborah is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Deborah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget, at 48 years old, is seeing her dream fulfilled, which is to be an independent person and have her own business. Thanks to the introduction of Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders in her life, she can achieve this dream and continue upward. Bridget is a very ambitious and enterprising go-getter who hails from the Kitale area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of seven and has been doing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Her primary sources of income are from selling eggs, milk and crops and from some personal business she does to make ends meet. Bridget loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow. She really takes good care of her dairy cows. The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticultural farming, which is good soil, climate and a transport system as well as an existing market for horticulture products. Bridget wants to take advantage of these conditions and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to start this new enterprise. Through an increased income, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. The financial benefits that Bridget will reap will be almost immediate; hence she will be assured a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture products to international markets once she has accumulated more profits.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Erina

texts.en:
Erina is 39 years old, hardworking, and married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is still in the same businesses of selling secondhand clothes and bricklaying for income generation. She began the business to generate income for her family. 

Her family vision is educating her children to university, and her business vision is to have a modern boutique with latest fashions and designs. However, she faces a challenge of competition and limited capital to satisfy her customers' preferences. Erina needs a loan to buy secondhand shirts and dresses to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 23 years old. He lives with his family in Zugdidi district. 

John requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his family’s poor living conditions. 

Then John requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products. 

John has already rented a place in the center of the city. The place is very profitable to open a fast food stall, where he will sell doner (also known as doner kebabs). With the received credit, John will purchase the stock of raw materials to make doner and a refrigerator for juices. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a fast food stall and sell doner

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio, es un pequeño agricultor de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida, con quien tiene 4 hijos, no asistió a estudiar.

Los ingresos que Policarpio, obtiene provienen de la venta de los granos básicos, también trabaja en la actividad conocida como jornalero, que hace relación en ayudar a otros agricultores al momento de preparar la tierra para realizar trabajos agrícolas. 

Policarpio, se creció rodeado de ganado y poco a poco fue conociendo como criar vacas y obtener provecho de los productos que se derivan de la leche. 

El crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar una vaquilla y para que en poco tiempo le proporcione leche, para poder venderla y obtener ingresos para los gastos del hogar. 

Los planes para Policarpio, son comprar más vacas, para que la producción de leche aumente y tenga  mayores ingresos, ya que sus hijos van creciendo y demandan mayores gastos en alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Policarpio is a small farmer who is 34 years of age. He lives with his life companion and they have four children, none of whom are in school.

Policarpio earns his income by selling basic grains, but he also works as a day laborer. This means that he helps other farmers when they have to prepare their land for planting.

Policarpio grew up around cattle, so he gradually learned how to raise these animals and take advantage of the products that can be made with the milk. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a heifer that can produce milk after some time. He will sell the milk so that he can generate household income.

Policarpio plans to buy more cows so that he can increase milk production and have more income. His children are growing, so he will have more expenses for food, health care, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de quatre femmes a été crée depuis le 20Avril 2010 .Il regroupe des femmes habitant du même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
LA responsable madame Fatou est une femme marié âgée de 40 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 5 garçons et 1 fille.
Son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs CFA lui permettra de payer des paniers de poissons divers destinés à la revente au détails au niveau du port de sa localité.
Madame Fatou dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group, made up of four women, was created on the 20 April 2010.  It brings together women who live in the same neighbourhood, united by good social and professional relationships.  

The woman in charge, Fatou, is a married woman aged 40 and mother of 6 children, of whom 5 are boys and 1 a girl.  Her new loan of 500000 CFA will allow her to buy baskets of a variety of fish which will then be resold retail around the local port.

Fatou has good experience in this field of business as she has been doing it for a long time.  The income gained will allow her to meet her family's needs for food.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh fish as an income generating activity

loans.name: Erick  Antonio

texts.es: Erick de 33 años de edad se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años y ya tiene clientes fijos que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Erick vive con su esposa en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Erick is 33 years old and has been selling roasted cashews for four years. He already has established customers who prefer the quality of his product and the good prices. Erick lives in his own home along with his wife.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy more cashews in bulk so that he can continue his work. As a result, he and his wife will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cashews in bulk.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 55 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dionisia has a computer gaming station business in the Philippines. Dionisia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers and to pay electric bills.

Dionisia has been in this business for 14 years. Dionisia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers and to pay electric bills.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is a 37-year-old married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Bernardita has a buy-and-sell used shoes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy bundles of used shoes to sell.

Bernardita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 62-year-old married mother of four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Conchita has a buy-and-sell beauty products business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 38 years old and married with four children, who are all currently in school. Angeles works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Angeles has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

Angeles would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 62 years old and married with five children. Luz works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (Kiva's partner) to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. Luz has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years, and she also earns an income from fish vending. Luz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who sells produce, is a married man of 28 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

He started his business in 2009 to supplement his income from farming. He desires to grow his business despite challenges of bad weather causing difficulties in transportation due to muddy roads.

John is asking for a loan to buy more maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling, since he is hard working.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children in Kutaisi district. Her husband works in Turkey and sends some money to his family. Madona is unemployed and wants to start her own business.

The Start up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 800 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of clothes to resell. This will increase her family income. With increased income, Madona will provide better living conditions to her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes in order to generate income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Novavie

texts.en: Novavie is a 35-year-old woman living in the province of Leyte, Philippines. She is married and has three children ages 10, 8, and 1. Novavie has raised hogs for her source of income for more than a year. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business. In the future, Novavie hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save some of her earnings to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old, single man from Jenin City, Palestine. He opened a women's clothing store ten months ago in the city. It is a very good business and the demand is high. Mohammad would like to improve his business and expand it, so he took a 1,000 USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (Kiva's partner). This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing for the spring. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and his income. Mohammad appears in the photo in his clothing store.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing for the spring.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 52-year-old, married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Elisa also raises pigs in her backyard. These are the sources of her income.  

Elisa is asking to take a loan to buy stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and animal feed for the pigs. A loan will help her improve her store and her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Diatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de six femmes a été crée depuis le 20 avril 2010 et ses membres sont unis par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. La responsable madame Diatou est une femme mariée agée de 39 et mère de sept enfant dont trois garçons et quatre filles.
Madame Diatou s'active dans le commerce dans la restauration de différents repas.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée .Avec son nouveau crédit de cinq cent mille francs CFA elle va se payer des sacs de riz des bidons d'huile du sucre du lait des légumes des poissons et de la viande pour la préparation de petit déjeuner repas de midi et du soir destinés à la vente au niveau de son restaurant.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group, made up of six women, was created on 20 April 2010.  Members are united through good social and professional relationships.  The person in charge, Diatou, is a married woman aged 39 and mother of seven children, of whom three are boys and four girls.   

Diatou is in the restaurant business, creating a range of meals.  She has good practical experience in this field.  With her new loan of five hundred thousand francs CFA she will purchase sacks of rice, cans of oil, sugar, milk, vegetables, fish and meat to prepare meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner to be sold in her restaurant.  The income gained through this work will allow her to meet the food, education and health needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, condiments and vegetables for her restaurant

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 52 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Epifania has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Epifania successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Epifania has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dhimiter

texts.en:
Dhimiter is a father of four and married. His kids range in age from 12 to 20, and they are going to respective schools.

For the past almost fifteen years, Dhimiter has been repairing old refrigerators and laundry washing machines. He wanted to expand the activity by buying some parts and tools.

In addition to this activity, he’s got some agricultural land where he plants wheat for the family’s needs. Dhimiter also has four beehives and sells 50 kg of honey/year at a price of $1/kg. Kindly note that almost every household in their village owns some beehives, and milk cows as well. Villagers also plant beans, potatoes and onions in large quantities, and they are known in the country for this delicious produce.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his refrigerator and laundry washing machine repair business.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz is 51 years old. He is married and has two beautiful daughters and a son. He earns an income for his family by working as a labourer.  In his free time, he works as a taxi driver. The total income of Ramiz is 125 AZN monthly and it doesn't cover the family's needs. 

The family lives in an old house with an old broken fence. They have no water and the bathroom is also old and broken. In order to cover water demands, Ramiz gets his water from a neighbour. He applied for 1,000 AZN loan in to order install a water pump and water pipes in the house and in his small garden. He wants to provide his family with a good life in their old house. This is his fourth loan from Aqroinvest Credit Union and he is a good client with a positive client history.

loans.use: to order install a water pump and water pipes in the house

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Enkhbaatar, 37 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been providing a taxi service to local people since 2008. Before 2008, he worked as a bookkeeper at a library for six years. His wife works as an assistant teacher at a kindergarten.

Their older child studies at secondary school while their younger child is in kindergarten. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land.

He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a small piece of agricultural land. He will grow crops on his purchased land and sell them later to supplement his income.

loans.use: to buy a small piece of land for agricultural use

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es: Andrés de 56 años de edad viven casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace 20 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Andrés está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés is 56 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife. He has been making trips with his pickup truck for 20 years. Andrés has many customers who prefer to do business with him because he is responsible when he drives. With the income he earns from his work, Andrés is able to pay for his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy tires and pay for the maintenance of his vehicle since this is the only means by which he can work. As a result, he will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en:
Jalil is a 25-year-old, single man. He has worked as an electrician for six years to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hardworking and ambitious man who has a good reputation and is trusted by his customers.

Today, Jalil is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop his business through buying a necessary toolkit, which will facilitate his work and provide his customers with better service. Jalil hopes to expand his business in the future, to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a necessary toolkit to provide his customers with better service.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is a 27-year-old married woman, and a mother of a three-year-old child from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than a year now. Joann is asking to take a loan to buy piglets, animal feed, and others. 

A loan will help her improve her hog raising business, as well as her income. In the future, Joann dreams of making her business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, animal feed, etc.

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
Bornes is 59 years old, married, and has children. She is a farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Siongiroi in the Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past 15 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbages, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows and sells milk. Bornes has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. 

Bornes mobilized other women in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women. She requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy another motorbike. Bornes is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence she suffers many losses. Perishable products such as milk and vegetables require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. With this loan Bornes is going to achieve her dream and goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Bornes feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo  that help women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because Bornes will never suffer losses due to delays in delivery of produce to the marke. She will also increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, hence increased income level. Bornes is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With this loan, Bornes will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport produce to the market

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Nancy, a farmer from Siongiroi. Siongiroi is a remote area in Kenya, an area known for producing the best marathon runners, who have broken world records. 

This lovely mother is not interested in any farming activity other than dairy, which she started doing three years ago and never looked back. She loves it! Her main source of income is milk. Nancy is very appreciative of the fact that milk prices in the region are high. This enables her to enjoy a good profit margin and expand her operations. She has named her favorite dairy cows. Milking and feeding her cows is her hobby. 

Nancy is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow in order to boost milk production, to increase sales volume. She believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in her diet to be healthy. 

Nancy will use the additional income she will make to further her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave is a 61-year-old villager and a mother of three grownups. For almost 19 years, she’s been doing livestock; having cows (currently she has three) and planting food for animals, including fodder and shamrock, on the 35 dynym agricultural land that she owns. Dave plants also seasonal veggies, but for her family’s needs. 

Her family’s monthly income includes her pension of $92/month, her husband’s pension of $144/month and the cash she makes from selling three calves a year, and also by selling raw milk to some nearby dairy farms. Dave is seeking your financial help to buy a grass reaper and a soil drill machine.

loans.use: to buy a grass reaper and a soil drill machine.

loans.name: Ndue Gjin

texts.en:
Ndue will start preparing the soil for planting. He has some agricultural land, and also has recently rented from some other villagers, about 4 dynym of agricultural land. He plants corn and beans in large quantities and sells them to make an income. 

Kindly note that Ndue is in his best outfit, because according to him, he did not feel very comfortable being dressed in those very old clothes and ugly working outfit. It is also a sort of tradition that people have to be dressed properly when a photograph is about to be taken.

loans.use: to prepare the soil for spring planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the legal fees for the property where he lives.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad  55, is a hard-working man. He's been a farmer his whole life, and tends to crops and cattle. He inherited this profession from his parents, so he gained much experience just by being born into it. He has a small portion of land where he grows onions, carrots, and other vegetables. He sows and harvests twice a year and usually gets a good harvest. 

Now he  is going to grow other kinds of vegetables and offer them to local people, but his situation is very difficult. He needs to plant fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region is a problem for him. Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. 

He applied for a loan of 900 AZN in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. He will purchase for irrigational system tools and install this system in his garden. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise. This is going to be his first loan, please support him.

loans.use: to purchase for irrigational system tools and install this system in garden

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira lives in Gissar district with her family. She is 22 years old. She is engaged in mobile phone selling. She started this business three years ago. Zamira is a simple and kind person. Her friends like her very much and always support her with this activity. Thanks to them she has opened her own point of sales in  market. Zamira is always trying help her parents and be independent. She also cares for her brother and sister. Zamira decided to improve her activity. She is requesting a loan to increase her income and expand her business. Zamira believes with your help she will achieve her goals

loans.use: To expand her activity.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is a goal-oriented woman. She was born in 1986. She is living in a rural area. She is divorced and has one child. 

Mahbuba is a patient, wise, kind and educated person. She was taught to work hard and make progress from childhood. In 2013, she divorced her husband and she lives at her parents' house now. Her father is a pensioner and her mother is a part-time worker. Her parents cannot cover all expenditures and needs. Mahbuba decided to start a business with buying and selling women clothes. She has been trading about seven months already. She wants to expand her business. She is asking for financial support to buy women clothes for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women clothes for increasing working capital

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en: Marziya is a goal oriented woman. She was born in 1985. She is living in a remote district. She is a divorced. She is a teacher. She teaches in secondary school. She teaches history for pupils. She is a well educated, punctual, kind and progressive person. Pupils are very satisfied in her classes. She wants to renovate her house. She is planning to make a better standard of living. Marziya is requesting financial support to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for her new house

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, 56, is married and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has an adult-age son. 

In order to help her family, she began a dried fish vending business six years ago, with the support of Paglaum MP Cooperative (PMPC). She then thought of expanding her resources and began a hog raising business for added income. Now, she is planning to borrow PHP 10,000 from PMPC, of which she became a member in 2008. She needs the loan to buy more fish to dry and sell, and to buy feed for her growing hogs. 

She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish and be able to sell meat too. Someday she will be happy seeing her family with a comfortable life and live happily with them.

loans.use: to buy fish to dry and sell, and feed for her growing hogs.

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en: Melchor, 37, is a married man with five children. He lives in Acad, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He has run a sari- sari store (small convenience store) for five years. He joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (Kiva's partner) in 2012. He has asked for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks such as grocery items for his sari-sari store. In the future, Melchor wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as grocery items.

loans.name: Yorkinoy

texts.en:
Yorkinoy is a merciful woman. She was born in 1983. She is living in a rural area. She is a sewer and she is married. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. She has two children. 

She has been doing a business for about seven years; she sews traditional dresses for women. Her activity was started when she learned how to sew from sewers. Yorkinoy likes her business, and gets a lot of satisfied clients. She wants to enlarge her activity. 

She is planning to buy a new sewing machine in order to work progressively. She has requested financial support for the enlargement of her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine in order to work progressively

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a single mother having one child. She is age 37, living in Balide, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She been in a business of RTW since 2010 as her source of income. 

She became a member of GDMPC in 2012, and availed a loan amounting P 40,000 for additional capital for her business in RTW.

Arlene plans to improve their living conditions and make it a better one, and also make improvements on her house.

loans.use: for additional capital for her ready to wear business

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en: Eustaquia is a 64-year-old widow who has one child. She lives in Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has been a food vendor for five years already, and she earns her living from food vending. She joined the GDMPC family and became a member in 2008. Eustaquia needs additional capital for her business. She availed herself of a loan amount of PHP 10,000. Eustaquia is planning for sustainability for her business and aspires to expand it to a bigger one.

loans.use: to purchase additional variety of stocks for food vending

loans.name: Maria Hazel

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Maria Hazel is married and has children. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Maria Hazel works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Maria Hazel is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral.

For this reason Maria Hazel is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 12,000 PHP loan to pay for the tuition of her child who is already in college.

Maria Hazel hopes that her two children will be able to finish their studies and find jobs with the right fit later on. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help.

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Maria Hazel before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for her child's tuition.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a 52-year-old widow with seven children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Concepcion has been farming sugarcane for 30 years and also earns income from selling firewood and farming coffee. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dry goods. Josephine is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Tessie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun still runs his clothes trading business which many years till today is the only source of income for his family. Harutyun has already four successfully paid back Kiva loans, which greatly developed his business. Now he hopes that his fifth request also will be accepted by Kiva's generous lenders. 

He works at the city’s wholesale market at a rented stall. He has a nice and great assortment of women's and men's clothes. He says that his stall’s merchandise is always very attractive for his customers, since he chooses colorful and fashionable clothes, and prices are also not very expensive. Once a month Harutyun rents a car, and he gets his stall products from Yerevan. His wife greatly helps him in his business, especially on the days when he comes to Yerevan to buy new merchandise for his trading business. Harutyun lives in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. He is happily married;he has a son and two daughters. Harutyun has no higher education, and for over 15 years he has earned his family's living through his clothes trading business. 

This loan he needs for renewing his stall with new clothes, which will remind all his customers about the upcoming sunny and warm spring; he will buy bags and vests both for women and men.

loans.use: to buy bags and vests both for women and men

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli works hard to support her family. Arceli is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish.

Arceli has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Arceli would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Tollen Lom Group

texts.en:
Ms Kimhoihching is a 34-year-old married woman. She is the person with her hand raised in the picture. She is also the representative of the group 'Tollen Lom'. She is a mother to a 2-year-old daughter. The villagers are mostly engaged in daily wage earning as there is no proper government infrastructure or social reforms for a better life for the people provided in that area. 

Ms Kimhoihching, as she belong to a poor family and has fewer educational qualifications, couldn’t go for other jobs, but instead opened a small tea stall on her own land which was given by her forefathers. She runs the tea stall with a hope of earning more income for her family household expenses. Her husband too is engaged in daily wage earning. But the income she gets is not sufficient for her family maintenance. 

She wants to expand her tea stall and run it in a better way by purchasing more items but she couldn’t do so as she lacks sufficient income. While she was unable to fulfil her family household requirements, it was not possible to buy more items for her tea stall. She was in a dilemma, as she didn't know how to get more income to fulfil her hopes. 

She went out to ask for money from her relatives and friends but unluckily they couldn’t help her as they weren’t in a condition to help her as they too were in the same situation. She was very sad and was in despair. She set out to take loans from money lenders but to her surprise the interest rates were too high and she returned back without taking the loan because if she took the loan, she wouldn’t be able to repay it along with the interest. 

While she was in her tea stall, a friend of her came and told her about WSDS providing loans with low interest rates. She hurriedly applied for the loan with a hope of a bright future by buying more items for her tea stall so that she could expand her tea stall and earns more income than before so as to manage her family household expenses. She is grateful to the funders and the organization for their work. She almost gave up on her hopes but WSDS makes her stay put on her hope once again. She wishes the organization best of the best and says, ‘Long live WSDS’.

The rest of the members of the group are needing, and have therefore requested, loans to start their respective business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like milk powder, edible oil, wheat flour, tea leaves, bread to expand her  tea stall.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato, who is a 45-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Kldistskaro. She has 4 children, from whom 2 is a student and 2 are school-age and a husband, who is temporarily unemployed. The family members live under poverty, having no source of significant income for existence, and the children require much for developing in life. 

Nato gets a small income from selling agricultural products, fruits and vegetables. She has a plot of agricultural land and cultivates it seasonally. To increase the productivity and monthly income, Nato has great desire to expand her agribusiness and start dairy farming. 

She requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow to start dairy farming. She will produce milk products for local trading and also for feeding her family. Nato will get her own customers, and will get the opportunity to increase the living conditions of her family. 

She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product between Kiva and Credo. The program allows the rural poor, like Nato, to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business.

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her children a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. 

Nato is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: To start dairy farming and expand her agribusiness

loans.name: Selman

texts.en:
Selman is a 58-year-old villager and a married father of two, 24 and 22 years old. In the photograph is him and his wife, Lirije. Selman wants to buy two female baby calves; at the moment he has none and the reason why he wants to invest in baby calves is that he plans on building a dairy farm. Buying baby calves instead of dairy cows is cheaper.
Selman's focus up until now has been in agriculture; he owns about 13 dynym of agricultural land where he plants wheat, beans, fodder and vetch; in between beans, he plants broom straws. He sells most of the produce at the local farmer’s market and sells the animal feed to villagers who have cows.

loans.use: to start a dairy farm by buying two female baby calves at the moment

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Trabajar y ahorrar son dos cosas que siempre dan buenos frutos y este hábito es el que le permitió a José iniciar su propio negocio desde hace 12 años. Luego de haber emigrado a Costa Rica, trabajar arduamente durante 3 años y regresar a Nicaragua con la ilusión de poner un negocio, José, inició sus actividades en el cultivo de tomates y chiltomas, las cuales comercializa en su pueblo, con el objetivo de crecer y tener una mejor vida financiera para él y su familia.

José solicita el crédito para mejorar el rendimiento e incrementar las áreas de terreno donde cultiva sus productos, además, para la compra de urea, abono, insecticidas, fungicidas y mano de obra para cultivar media parcela más de chiltoma. Esto le ayudará a crecer en su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias. Sus metas son poder obtener una buena cosecha de sus productos y entre sus planes esta ahorrar para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Working and saving are two things that always bear fruit, and this habit is what allowed José to start his own business 12 years ago. After having emigrated to Costa Rica, working hard for 3 years and returning to Nicaragua with the dream of starting a business, José started his business growing tomatoes and peppers. which he sells in his town. He has a goal of growing and having better finances for himself and his family.

José is applying for the loan to improve yield and to increase the land area where he grows his products. He also wants to buy urea, compost, insecticides, and fungicides, and to pay for labor to farm a half a plot more of peppers. This will help him to grow his business and increase his earnings.

His goals are to be able to get a good harvest for his products, and among his plans are to save to build a house.

loans.use: to buy urea, compost, insecticides, and fungicides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ensaf

texts.en:
Ensaf is 58 years old woman, she is married and has 5 children, three of them are working in army .
She does not work, but her husband has a small farm, and he is working a little bit in sheep trade .
Ensaf wishes to help her husband to buy some sheep to breed lambs, then they will be able to sell them and generate profits, also they will use their milk, to make dairies products to enhance the family income.she has applied for a loan to finance her husband to buy more sheeps .

loans.use: To pay for  buy more sheeps to increase the volume of dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover his university fees.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 32 years old with 3 children ages 9, 5 and 1 year old. Her business is buying and selling clothes together with her husband Edward. She started as a sales lady in the mall in clothing area and her husband’s a sales boy in a buy and sells clothes. In 2003, they decided to have their own business using their own savings in a stall her older sister gave her. She started with selling shirts for men and women and eventually added clothes for children and dresses for teens.  

Irine bought readymade dresses mostly coming from Hong Kong and Thailand, which are the same practice with the other clothing stores. However, income is not consistent because of its seasonal nature. Prices of readymade dresses goes up during certain months.  So, she came up with the idea of buying yards of fabric, designing and asking a dressmaker to sew clothes because it is cheaper compared to buying readymade clothes to sell but the problem is she doesn’t have the capital.

With the help of a friend in January 2014 she joined SEED programs and even attended a skills training. Her first loan in the amount of PhP 8, 000 brought her idea into reality. She bought different yards of fabrics (cotton, denim, corduroy, linen) and had those made in her own design (from dress, to crop pants, long sleeves and skirts). She sells it to her store in much lower price and it became popular with the costumer.  Much more to her surprise she now has a costumer buying in bulk of her design clothes gaining her a net of PhP 5,000 daily. Her second loan of PhP 10, 000 she added to buy more fabrics to accommodate her new costumers.

With the loan her business improved. She has now more costumer buying bulks of her clothes. She has increased her savings for their children and bought a new refrigerator. Still she needed help in to maintain her growing business. 
Now she asks for a loan amounting to PhP 27,000 to buys yards of fabric of cashmeres, silks, polyesters, and for the initial rental advance to a second stall in addition to her current clothing stall.  She still continues to attend SEED’s trainings to help her improve her knowledge on business. She also saves enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy yards of fabric of cashmeres, silks, polyesters to be sewn as dresses, and for the initial rental advance to a second clothing stall she will set up

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy, 26, lives in Kratie province with her husband, Heng. They are clothes seller. They don't have any children yet. They sells clothes to the villagers. Her husband help her to buy clothes from whole sellers at provincial town. They use solar home system and also sometime generator to supply electricity in their house and shop. The supply of electricity from existing solar system and generator is not enough and using the generator is very costly. She decide to apply for loan to buy one more solar system. It will help her reduce cost in her business and easier to live.

loans.use: to buy solar system

location.town: Buk Toek Village, Preaek Brasab Commune, Preaek Br

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 38 years old, a housewife with 3 children of which the eldest is 11 and the youngest is only 3 years old. Her husband is working as a maintenance worker in an office building. They lived in their own house together with her 2 nieces and her mother.

She started her business using her own savings from her previous work abroad. In 2005 she started with a capital of PhP 30, 000 and builds her wholesale grocery store in which most her costumers owns mini-grocery in their neighborhood. She started with snack foods, candies, noodles, prepaid cell phone loads, soft drinks, laundry soaps, canned goods and sauces. She earns a net of PhP 7, 000-9,000 daily.
