She expands her business using again her savings and builds a computer shop with 7 units of computer just in front of her store. Her computer shop earns her a net of PhP 3,000 daily. In 2011 she decided to build another wholesale grocery store in the market with a capital of PhP 100, 000 and employed her niece as a caretaker with two helpers to assists her. It gains her a net of PhP 13,000 daily.

Agnes also helps the community in terms of employment generation. She has 4 helpers, 2 of which are employed in her computer shop and the 2 other are employed in her mini-grocery. One of her helper is her neighbor’s undergraduate and unemployed daughter which she employs only on a 4-hour work schedule per day in order for this employee to still attend school. Her 2 other helpers are also unemployed and working for her are their only source of income. 

In December 2014 she came to know SEED when she was invited by a friend whom also a member to attend an orientation held near their place.  She joined the orientation, business and skills training. She likes it because of its low interest rate and other social programs.

She is requesting for a loan amounting to PhP 100, 000 to buy her sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, coffee, and diapers for a second mini-grocery she is planning to set up near her first store.  Her plan is c. But the most important of all she did all of these because of her children. She wanted them to have a bright future and best education.

loans.use: To buy her sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, coffee, and diapers to maintain her growing business and employ neighbors as helpers in her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and separated for 25 years. She has 2 children all grown up and they live with her together with their families. 

Being a High School graduate and has limited employment options, she started vending when her husband stopped supporting them financially.  Her first business was selling groceries using a cart on the street near the market. However, government does not allow vendors on streets and are considered as illegal. Thus, from time to time Elizabeth faces difficulty in selling her goods and experiences her items being confiscated by the police. This prompted Elizabeth to save in view of a plan of setting up a store where security and stability of business is not anymore a concern. 

When she saved enough money, she started a mini grocery store just in front of her house using PhP 3,000 as starting capital. She bought packs of snack foods, candies, noodles, biscuits, coffee, laundry soaps and bath soaps and from those gained a net income of PhP 500 – 750 daily. She saved half of the money and spent half for her children’s needs. When she saved enough she decided to expand her small grocery into a wholesaler grocery store, gaining her an income of PhP 3,000-4,000 daily and a net of PhP 5,000-6000 weekly.

She came to know SEED from a member who is also one of her regular customers. She invited Elizabeth to attend an orientation about SEED programs. She now asks for a loan amounting to PhP 50,000 to buy her 3 sack of sugar, 5 sacks rice, soft drinks, and oil in addition to her own stocks which are demanded by her costumers. 

Her store helps support their family even now that her daughter and son are both living with her with their families. Her store also helps in supporting her 2 granddaughter’s education since their parents have limited capacity of financing their children. Her children were not able to finish school due to poverty and owing to the fact that before her business was only able to support their family’s most basic needs. This time, Elizabeth wants to turn the table and ensure that her grandchildren will be able to finish their education. The wholesale store is still their family’s main source of income. However, Elizabeth and her family stands a better chance of earning with potential support for their business coming from micro finance institutions such as SEED.

loans.use: To buy her 3 sack of sugar, 5 sacks rice, soft drinks, and oil to fill the demand of her customers

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng,57, is a rice farmer and lives in Kratie province with his wife. He also grow pigs and cows. His wife sells Khmere Noodle to the villagers. They have three children.  Two of them are already married and the last child Phoun (21) is a student. 

There is no grid electricity in their village. Now they use battery to light their house, but battery is not healthy and it's expensive. So he decided to apply for loan to buy Solar system to make it easier for his child to study and improve their living condition.

loans.use: buy a solar home system

location.town: Damnak Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old, a housewife with 5 children of which the eldest is 19 and the youngest is 10 years old. 

To earn their keep, Agnes set up a general store with her husband helping her in operations. Her husband used to be an overseas worker, but got sick and needed to go back home. It was providential that Agnes was able to save when her husband was still working. With the PhP 20,000 she saved, Agnes invested in a general store.  

Initially she sold noodles, coffees and biscuits, sugars, cooking oil, canned goods, laundry soaps, candies and soft drinks.  Seeing that there are too many other general stores in their community, Agnes thought that she will gain more and help other micro-entrepreneurs in her community if she can upgrade her store to do wholesaling.

With hard work and continuous savings, Agnes slowly expanded her store until she was able to wholesale additional commodities such as eggs, condiments and toiletries. With these items now on wholesale, their store became popular to their neighbors.  Agnes also  claims that she is able to have more customers now in as much as smaller stores in her community need not go to the City market do buy goods anymore.  She is able to earn a net of PhP 4, 000-5,000 a day. However, most of her costumers are asking her to sell rice since it’s a staple Filipino food item. Unfortunately she doesn't have the capital to invest into wholesale rice vending.

In December 2014 she learned about SEED through a friend who is also a member of the organization. She joined the orientation, business and training programs and she like it because of its low interest rate and social services. 
Agnes is requesting for a loan amounting to PhP 50,000 to buy an initial 25 sacks of rice for wholesaling and materials for the construction of rice storage. With this investment Agnes is confident of increasing more her income and also in being able to help other smaller stores in her community.

In the future she also plans on building a piggery in their province, since her mother used to have one before. But more than that, she wanted to save for the future of her children, especially with their education.

loans.use: To buy an initial 25 sacks of rice and for the construction of rice storage in her wholesale store

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en: Humaira is 28 years of age. She is a single lady. She is shown in the photo with her brother. Her great skill in hand embroidery and an experience of many years in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her hand-embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for her household expenditures. For the improvement of her business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and needles in large quantities. It will help her in meeting the orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and needles in large quantities.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives in the Abseron region with four members of her family. They have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Agdam city for 22 years. Arzu’s husband, Rauf, is a butcher, and her daughter Nigar and son Ali go to school. 

Arzu has been engaged in a tailoring business for five years. She sews skirts, blouses, and other women's clothes, as well as curtains. She receives orders from her periodic customers, and prepares orders. Today she is planning to increase her working capital to buy new material. For this reason she is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,100 AZN. She is thankful to the Kiva and Komak organizations for a loan. In the future she wants to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy a new material, increase business, in future she want help to her children in education.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is divorced and has two sons. Natalya is a seamstress working at a factory. She's been working there for seven years. Natalya lives in a house with one son. Now they are doing some renovations on the house. Natalya is asking for a loan of 20 000 UAH to replace five windows and a door in her house. The loan will help Natalya to save heat in the house during the winter.

loans.use: to install five windows and a door in the house for better insulation and energy saving

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is a jeepney driver living at Enrile with his family. He gets income by providing a jeepney transport business. He was able to sustain the needs of his family, especially the education of his children.

He wanted to make his business profitable by providing good and safe travel to all his passengers. For this, he is asking for additional capital to buy crude oil and pay for maintenance of the jeepney. He needs PHP 7,000.

He promises to pay back his loan in full and continue to be a responsible father all the time.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and pay for maintenance of the jeepney.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de pescado de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pescados por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 52-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her three children. For the past 10 years, she has been selling fish as a street vendor in different markets near her home. With the income she earns, Maria is able to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more fish in bulk. This will enable her to earn more income so that she can provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Oltinoy

texts.en:
Oltinoy is a young resident of the N.Khusrav district. She is 24 years old. She lives with her husband and they engage in a livestock business. She started this activity 2 years ago and she got a good result. Thanks to this business they have improved their lives. 

At the moment her activity is developing, but she wants to expand it more and get a good income. Her husband is a builder. He builds beautiful houses but also manages to help his wife in her activities She likes milking cows and providing the family with milk and dairy products. Oltinoy is taking a loan to buy a few head of cattle for expanding her livestock business. She hopes you will see her request and support her. Today your support is very important for her.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 22 years old and married. She has managed a motor parts business for two years already, and while her husband is also working as a OFW , where they get their source of living. 

Mary Ann became a member of GDMPC in 2014, and she borrowed a loan amounting P 20,000 to purchase additional stocks of motor parts to increase her inventory in her store. In the future, Mary Ann is planning to have savings out from her business and expand her business in motor parts.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of motor parts to increase her inventory in her store.for additional capital for her business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is thankful for the loan previously granted to her. She was able to purchase products and supplies needed to improve her profit from her business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as toiletries, clothing, undergarments, cosmetics and other items of the like, which she also sells. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Mercedita hopes that her business will continue to become successful and she dreams that her children will finish their studies.

Mercedita hopes that she will have a more stable source of income which will help her provide for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. That is also where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
His name is Wilfredo, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Fausta. He works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs.

Wilfredo operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. 

He earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum net income of PHP 600 a day. 

To help him continue operations of his general store business, Wilfredo is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan which he will use to buy grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, and other grocery items. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment and the financial help that will be given him. 

Wilfredo hopes to maintain and grow his business, so he and his wife could have a better life and prepare for their old age. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 43 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Carina has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal for one year and also earns an income from coconut palm-making and buying and selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Papin

texts.en:
Papin is very happy and very impatient for his third deal already with Kiva that he is going to have. His previous two Kiva loans greatly developed both his farming and agricultural activities.  Now his farm is richer with cattle and the variety of his farm products is greater. Papin lives in his nice house in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region with his wife and two sons. All the family, with great pleasure, is engaged in farming, where they take care of cows, bulls, sheep and chickens. On his plot of land, he cultivates potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers and greens. His farm products Papin sells at the city’s wholesale market with his son. The sale of his farm’s milk and other dairy products and eggs is his wife’s duty, which she organizes perfectly. So all the family, altogether and with care, do their best to make money from their farm products.

This loan Papin asks for because he wants to get prepared for spring sowing activities; he want to buy potato seedlings and fodder for his farm cattle until the spring months.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fodder for his farm cattle until the spring months

loans.name: Naseeba

texts.en:
Naseeba is a 59-year-old widow. 

One of her sons(also shown in the photo) is a van driver by profession. He drives to meet the expenses of his family. He wants to change the engine of his van, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Naseeba has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR for her son, who wants to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. 

Naseeba is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her son's van

loans.name: Kaneezan

texts.en: Kaneezan has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her eighth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase milk sales to gain more profits.

loans.name: Ma. Monserrat

texts.en:
Ma. Monserrat is 55 years old with one 18 years old child. Her husband Joseph 50 years old is a factory worker. Ma. Monserrat started her business to help her husband in their daily expenses and also save for their child’s education. 

Using the savings from her husband’s salary, she started to set up a small store from an initial capital of PhP 5,000. At that time she is able to earn PhP 1,500 to 2,000 a day. In 2011 she was invited to attend an orientation of SEED by a friend who is also a member. Consequently she was able to avail a first loan amounting to PhP 7,000 and used it as an additional capital for her business. 

Now her store has improved, she extended the store and was able to buy a new freezer. She is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy her frozen goods (sausages, hot dogs, and preserve sweetened pork and ham) to sell to her neighbors. These products are highly demanded in their community since these are easily cooked and convenient to prepare for those who leave their home early to work or attend school.
  
Her business helps financing the education of her child in college and she also starts savings for her and her husband’s retirement in their old age.

loans.use: To buy frozen goods such as sausages, hotdogs, preserve sweetened pork and ham as new products to sell in her store as demanded by customers

loans.name: Dilshad Baigum

texts.en:
Dilshad Baigum is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and has three sons and two daughters. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 25 years. Now, her son wants to grow the business. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Dilshad Baigum is applying for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband by purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.
 
Dilshad Baigum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es: Rosa tiene 31 años de edad, estudió su primaria de forma completa pero por problemas económicos no continuo estudiando. Ella está acompañada pero su compañero de hogar trabaja en el exterior EE.UU. De su relación tiene dos hijos, el mayor quien está estudiando en la escuela en su tercer año y el ultimo en el kinder. Su desempeño en este rubro es de 5 años aproximadamente aprendiendo la siembra y cultivo de guayaba de sus padres ayudando a dar mantenimiento su hermano y un cuñado. Como ingreso extra también se dedica a elaborar trabajos de corte y confección lo cual desarrolla en su casa de habitacion. Su propiedad de cultivos de guayaba está ubicada en la misma propiedad donde está construida su casa por lo que puede estar más al pendiente y cuidado del producto. Sus metas y sueños están enfocados en el aumento de sus cultivos, la ampliación de los mismos y en algún momento poder exportarla. El apoyo a sus hijos incondicional para que puedan prepararse académicamente y salir adelante. Mejorar su casa de habitacion para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida pues esta necesita ser reparada en algunas secciones. Rosa necesita este préstamo para pagar por personas que le ayuden a la limpieza de su propiedad, la aplicación de los diferentes insumos que serán comprados para aplicar a los mismos y evitar que el producto se llene de gusano o sea afectado por los diferentes cambios climáticos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old. She completed primary school, but due to financial problems, she didn't continue studying. She is in a relationship, but her domestic partner works abroad in the U.S. From this relationship, she has two children, the older of whom is in his third year of school and the younger in kindergarten.

She has been working in this field for approximately 5 years, having learned how to plant and grow guavas from her parents, with her brother and a brother-in-law helping to maintain the crop.

For extra income, she also works in dressmaking, which she does in the house where she lives. Her property for the guava crops is situated on the same property as her house, so she can take better care of her product.

Her goals and dreams are focused on increasing her crops, expanding them, and one day being able to export them. She unconditionally supports her children so that they can get educated and get ahead. She would also like to improve her house in order to offer her children a better quality of life, since some parts of the house need to be repaired.

Rosa needs this loan to pay people that help her to clean her property, to apply different inputs that will be purchased for this purpose, and to prevent her product from getting worms or being affected by different weather changes.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy inputs to apply to her guava crops.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 39 years old, married to an overseas worker and has 2 children aged 9 and 7.

As a housewife, she has difficulty in budgeting their money and save for the future education of their children with the very small income her husband earns abroad.  In order to support the family, Liza decided to set up a small computer shop in 2011 from the savings she set aside each time her husband remits money.   In setting up the shop, Liza was able to buy 7 units of second-hand computers.

With the computer business doing well, with patron of students from the community doing assignment and researches, Liza was able to save further and set up another business of small general store.

She wanted to expand her store and computer shop but her funds are not enough. She still needs to pay the maintenance repairs on the computers and rents for the store place. On January 2014 with a help of a friend, she came to know SEED, joined the business and skills training and was able to avail a first loan amounting to PhP 8, 000. The loan was used to buy computer parts (keyboard, mouse, computer and other peripherals) plus she was also able to repair the computer tables in her shop. 

Liza, on her 5th loan now is requesting PhP 20, 000. She intends to buy rice, prepaid load for mobile phones and frozen meat products which are demanded by customers in her general store. Liza maintains that the store is a big help during instances when income from the computer shop is low.

In the future, Liza wants to grow her store and acquire a bigger place for her computer shop. She hopes that with this, her husband needs not to work abroad and be away from their family.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as sacks of rice, prepaid load for cell phones and frozen goods (sausages, preserved sweeten meat and hot dog as new goods to sell to her costumers

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en: Nighat, aged thirty, is a married woman. Her husband is a tailor by profession and is shown in the photo with her. He stitches clothes for the people in his community and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. He is a well-known tailor in their locality. Due to electricity load shedding in Pakistan, UPS(uninterruptible power supply) devices have become a household item in Pakistan.  UPS is an electrical device to provide backup power in the event of a power failure or when there is no electricity on the mains. To improve her husband’s business, Nighat has availed a loan of 35,000 PKR from Murabaha. This allowed him to purchase UPS (uninterruptible power supply) for his tailoring shop along with some stitching material to meet customers’ orders on time, so that he can make a good amount of income.

loans.use: to purchase UPS( uninterruptible power supply) for his tailoring shop along with some stitching material to meet customers’ orders on time.

loans.name: M. Azeem

texts.en:
M. Azeem is a 37-year old man who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a single father of five children. He has only one source of income and has to manage utility and other household expenses on his own. The condition of his house is not up to the mark, according to the living standard.

He owns a small crockery store in which he sells items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons, and buckets. He wants to buy more inventory to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in a large quantity to make a dowry. A larger inventory would help him cope with a sudden increase in demand.

He has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can generate more income. He is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan because they showed him a beam of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Menalyn

texts.en:
Menalyn is a 25 years old working and married to an ambulant vendor using a customized bicycle for selling plastic wares.  Since, they have no children, Menalyn and her husband makes it a point to save and most of the time also help finance the farming activity of her husband’s family. 

On January 2014 she came to know SEED through a friend. Her first loan amounting to PhP 7,000 was used to buy another bicycle and plastic ware stocks such as pails, food storage, plates, clothes pin, basin and tub.  With another bicycle to use for ambulant vending, Menalyn and her husband was able to employ her husband’s distant relative from the province.
   
On her 4th loan now, Menalyn is requesting PhP 15,000 to buy new plastic ware products such as chairs, clothes hangers, laundry baskets and to pay rental advances for a stall to sell their products in a big public market they wanted to acquire.  

Menalyn knows that with this business plan actualized she and her husband will be able to increase their income and at the same time be able to help other individuals by providing them employment in her stall.

loans.use: To buy new plastic ware products such as chairs, clothes hangers, laundry baskets and to pay rental advances for a stall to sell their products in the public market

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
From Coron Palawan, Nancy has been an active member of CCT for years now and she was able to acquire several loans to make a good profit from her business. At age 40, she is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs, and she was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day, and she is pretty sure enough that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Nancy owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone to make this happen. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, toothpaste or even an ice tube. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday, so she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future, and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Nancy meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and other stuff needed in her store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain under served by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Jane, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mother who is 53 years of age. She hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of 8 lovely, school-going children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Her primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming. 

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Nandi Hills area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereal for re-sale and thus improve her income. Jane's upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Jane has received training and proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Jane is quite a visionary and, with her accumulated profits, she hopes she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is an ambitious man, and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of horticulture products. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. 

Dickson is a 46-year-old father of nine who lives in the Kitale area, which is located in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. He has farmed for five years and earns an honest and decent income. Dickson has both crops and a dairy farm, and has a small business to make ends meet. Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Dickson. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces. 

Dickson seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. Dickson and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. Dickson is disciplined regarding finances, and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income and obtain a stable future for his family.

With a loan you will be able to support a father who is full of life and energy for his family!

loans.use: To venture into other areas of farming

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en:
Hoy’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hoy makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a traditional clothing maker to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
María, estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor pero también realiza labores de construcción, tiene tres hijos, los 2 mayores emigraron en busca de trabajo y en su casa solo viven sus 2 nietos los cuales dependen de sus ingresos.

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos pero también, ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos de la agricultura ; ella se encarga de preparar el grano para el consumo sus cultivos, primordialmente el de frijol y maíz para su consumo familiar.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar madera, clavos y pagar la mano de obra que reparará el techo de su casa, ya que la madera está dañada, porque su periodo de vida útil ya caducó.

Su mayor sueño es darle a su familia lo necesario y verlos algún día formados profesionalmente y asegurar que no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
María, who studied until the second grade, is in a relationship. Her partner is a farmer, but he also does construction work. She has three children. The two older ones emigrated in search of work, and only her two grandchildren live at home and are financially dependent on her.

María spends her time doing household chores, but she also helps her husband with the farming. She is responsible for preparing the grain for consumption, primarily beans and corn for her family's consumption.

She needs the loan to buy wood and nails, and to pay for labor that will repair the roof of her house. The wood is damaged, since it has already passed its lifespan.

Her greatest dream is to give her family what they need and to one day see them professionally trained, and to make sure that they always have their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy wood and nails, and to pay for labor to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
While many young people in Africa dream of getting well-paying jobs, Beatrice, from the Kericho area of Kenya, left her “peanuts” paying job to become a full-time smallholder farmer. She decided that she would be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. 

Beatrice is married and blessed with three children whom she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling,crop selling, poultry farming and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. Deciding to practice poultry farming for Beatrice was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my grandfather and grandmother,” Beatrice said. “It is in my blood.” 

For the past two years, Beatrice has been earning a decent income from dairy farming and poultry farming. However, the demand  for poultry is overwhelming, and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is the lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. 

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunity for entrepreneurs, and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. 

With your loan, Beatrice is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Beatrice is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Godi

texts.en:
Godi is a hardworking man of 31 years living in Kagadi, Uganda with four children. He has been dealing in a motorcycle transport business since 2005, and also farming for income generation.

He hopes to buy a vehicle to increase his income in spite of bad weather affecting his work, such as too much dust and too much rain. Godi is asking for a loan to buy another motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Outre Group

texts.en:
The Outré group consists of three hardworking and enterprising ladies who stay in Warren Park, located in Harare City of Zimbabwe. The group was formed with the aim of accessing loans to enable them grow their businesses and improve their standards of living.
Esinata, one of the group members, sells electrical gadgets at a shopping center in their neighborhood. She is also the chairperson of the group. Esinata is a widow with three school going children. She used to sell cosmetics as a supplement for the family’s income, but after her husband passed away in 2009, she decided to continue running her husband’s business after she realized that cosmetic business is not profitable enough to meet her family’s needs. She has been running this business successfully for the past five years but her major challenge was lack of funding.
With a loan amounting US$300 from Kiva, she hopes to restock electrical gadgets in larger quantities from Botswana where they are cheaper compared to local prices. Esinata has a good savings plan which will enable her to open an electrical shop one day.

loans.use: to increase her stock of electrical goodss for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
At first sight Karen seems like a quiet and unassuming woman, but when you get to talk to her you see that she is a goal oriented woman who is serious about her small business. She is a member of In God we Trust group based in Crowborough high density suburb in Harare. 

Karen and her group members are in their second loan cycle with Thrive Microfinance. Karen is a married mother of four children; with one still school going. With her 1st loan Karen procured more produce for her market stall and grew her business. Karen even managed to buy a four plate stove as a wedding present for her daughter with her profits. With her current loan Karen wants to buy bulk maize for resale as it is a fast moving commodity. In future Karen plans to work hard and buy herself a car which would make restocking easier for her. Karen has found the lessons she got at Thrive to be very useful in the running of her business, enabling her to be a better business woman.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk for wholesaling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To grow her poultry rearing business.

loans.name: Evergreen Group

texts.en:
Being a wife and mother of 5 children can be a big job on its own, but this has not stopped Anatoria from striving to reach great heights. Anatoria is a member of Evergreen group. Evergreen is in their 2nd loan cycle with Thrive. With her 1st loan Anatoria grew her grocery stall. Her business grew thereby increasing her profits. Anatoria appreciates the training she and her group members got from Thrive. She feels that she is now a better business woman than before she attended the lessons. The lessons in savings helped Anatoria immensely as she now has income to complement her husband's income. 

The growth in her business has been able to help improve her family’s standard of living and provide for their children, 3 whom are still school going. Anatoria even managed to apply for a passport with her profits and to join a housing cooperative. With her Kiva loan, Anatoria is planning on going to restock groceries in bulk in South Africa. She is planning to also start wholesaling groceries to other vendors in her neighbourhood.  Anatoria is also looking forward to being a homeowner and building a proper tuck shop structure to operate from.

loans.use: To start wholesaling groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her stock of food for resale.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Mildred, 47 is a member of the Ebenezer group. She has known her other member for more than 3 years as they have been doing cross boarder trading together. Mildred is a widow and since 1996 she has been supporting her family through her business of buying goods for resale from South Africa. However, her business faced challenges in growing owing to the very little capital she had and the economic hardships that the country was experiencing. This was when she was introduced to Thrive Microfinance in 2012. She received training and is currently applying for her fifth loan. 

Mildred is now able to pay for her children’s fees as well as meet all of her family needs. Mildred notes that, “I am happy and grateful because Thrive taught me how to manage my business well, and I am now competing with other women in the same business...” Having received lessons in business daily records and saving, Mildred was able to grow her business. Her future plans are to buy a car to start a taxi business as well as starting a bottle store.

loans.use: To expand her cross-border business.

loans.name: Way Forward Group

texts.en:
Rosemary, 52, is a member of the Way Forward group and she stays in Kuwadzana, Harare. Rosemary is a widow and has three children. She started selling bread, snacks and sweets six years ago in order to feed her family and afford school fees for her children. After realizing that the type of business she had engaged in was flooded, she started trading as a cross border supplying cell-phones. In trying to establish her business, Rosemary has faced many difficulties as she did not have the proper documentation which meant constant brushes with the Zimbabwe Revenue Authority and the police, who often confiscated her products. 

But that has since changed when she heard about Thrive. When she got her first loan, Rosemary was able to have the correct documents for travelling. She is now taking her third loan with Thrive. She is now a regular supplier of cell phones to 3 retail stores in Harare. She is now able to supply 200 Nokia and Samsung cell-phones at a given time. With a Kiva loan, Rosemary will be able to further develop her business. Mainly, Rosemary wants sustainability. She greatly appreciates the training that she received form Thrive. She is now able to use a daily record schedule which helps her understand whether her business is operating on a profit or a loss.

loans.use: increase the number of cellphones she imports to supply local stores.

loans.name: Wasara Wasara Group

texts.en:
Fungai is a member of the Wasara Wasara group at Thrive Microfinance. She is a widowed mother and is in the business of selling clothes. She runs a road side stall and this is her main source of income to support her two sons aged 8 years and 3 years. One of the challenges she faces is differentiating her business from her aggressive competitors in the industry. She believes that providing a variety of choice and quality clothes will help her to fight competition.
She hopes that a loan amounting $500 from Kiva will help her increase her stocking capacity, meet increasing customer demands and increase her economies of scale. One of her wish is to manage her own clothing shop. With her passion and energy she continues to look for better business opportunities.

loans.use: To increase the extent and variety of her stock.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa, 34 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a tailor at a carpet factory since 2012. Her husband is a firefighter at an emergency department. Their two daughters go to elementary school. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass and foam for renovation. After renovating her home, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate her Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling).

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenechimeg, 39 years old, lives with her husband and children in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a tailor at a private firm for 11 years. Her husband is currently unemployed due to downsizing at his company. He used to be a welder. 

Mrs. Erdenechimeg is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned so fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Tsogjavkhlan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsogjavkhlan, 47 years old, lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a manager at a private company since 2011. Her son studies at the university. Using her previous loans, she has renovated and expanded her house. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to pay the tuition fee for her son. The borrower has high expectation for her son, who studies very hard at the university.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for her son

loans.name: Moon Group

texts.en:
Natasha is the featured borrower for Moon Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Natasha is a 17-year-old single lady who is employed as an accountant with a limited income to cover her needs and expenses and to help her poor family. She is a hard working lady who is trying desperately to improve her living conditions.

Today, Natasha is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to start a new business of breeding sheep to increase her income and improve her living conditions. This loan will help Natasha make a step toward independence and build her future.

With respect to the other group members, Islam is a 38-year-old married mother of six children who has a livestock of cows and wants to buy more cows, while Sanaa is a 47-year-old married Palestinian mother of six children who works cleaning houses and wants to become a partner in the new cows Islam will buy.

Natasha is the first lady on the right, Islam is the first lady on the left, and Sanaa is the lady standing in the middle of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business of breeding sheep

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a 37-year-old married mother of three children, who has tailored and sold clothes for five years to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She also bakes and sells bread as a second source of income.
 
Latifa is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother, who is trying her best to develop her business and improve her living conditions. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes and to buy a generator for her tailoring machine for the electricity is unstable in Lebanon. She also wants to buy a kneader to facilitate her work and provide her customers with special bread.
 
Latifa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes, to buy a generator for her tailoring machine, and to buy a kneader.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru:
Мунавар проживает на районе Рудаки. У нее очень большая семья. Ей 53 лет. Она летняя замужем и мать четверых  детей. Ее муж пенсионер. У нее три сына и одна дочка. Старшие сыновья работают в сотовой компании. Младший сын и дочка учатся в университете. 
 Мунавар сама занимается шитьем женской одежды уже 7 лет. Она набрала хороший опыт и сейчас в день может сшить даже несколько женской одежды,  но ей надо поменять швейную машинку, потому что ее нынешняя машинка хорошо не работает, на оставшуюся часть денег она купит необходимые материалы для шитья. По этой причине Мунавар обратилась за кредитом. Мунавар с помощь этого кредита может приобрести себе новую машинку и много клиентов.
texts.en:
Munavar lives in the Rudaki district. She has a very big family. She is 53 years old. She is married and a mother of four children. Her husband is retired. She has three sons and one daughter. The older sons work at a mobile phone company. The younger son and daughter attend a university.

Munavar has been involved in sewing women's clothing for 7 years. She gained good experience and can now sew even several items of women's clothing per day, but she needs to replace her sewing machine because her current machine does not work well. She will buy necessary materials for sewing with the remaining money. This is why Munavar requested a loan. With the help of this loan, Munavar will be able to purchase a new sewing machine and attract many clients.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Salma Group

texts.en:
Lina is the featured borrower for Salma Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Lina is a 40-year-old married mother of four children who has been selling clothes for nine years to support her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their beloved family.

Lina is an ambitious lady, and she is working hard to develop her business. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes for this winter season to satisfy her customer's needs.

Lina is the lady sitting in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Salma is the first lady on the right, and Sanaa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes for this winter season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloths and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments and tubers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business and buy another stall to resell fruits and vegetables in it.

loans.name: Mesbah

texts.en:
Mesbah is a 33-year-old married man from Jenin city. He is a father of three sons and one daughter. Mesbah works as an employee in a sweets factory in the city; he gets a very low income. Mesbah would like to improve himself and also his family's living conditions, so he registered at the university to take a BA degree in Arabic Literature and find a better job.

Mesbah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mesbah will be able to read online articles and write his reports easily.

Mesbah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives in Kongasis village which is in the Rift valley province of Kenya. This is primarily a tea and maize growing region. She has a lovely family with Richard, her husband. To help her hubby provide for the family, Elizabeth ventured into farming a decade ago. Over the years, she has brought tremendous growth to the business. Today, she keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows tea among other crops. She is also invested in other personal businesses for additional income. Elizabeth enjoys dairy farming the most. She is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow in a bid to keep increasing the quantity of the farm's milk production. The money Elizabeth will make from selling the additional milk will help her to repay the debt and pay for her children's education, which is her highest expense. Elizabeth stated, "I will buy a cow that will produce more milk for sale. This will increase my family's monthly income."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tubers and fruit.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Cecilia, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman who hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is near the famous Mount Kenya (the second highest in Africa). She is 55 years of age and has been farming for the past eight years. Through those years, she has gathered so much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet. 

Cecilia is very passionate about farming, and she loves cultivating her farm. That is why every day she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although Cecilia makes a profit through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income through the selling of cereals. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals. 

The Nkubu area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals. That means that Cecilia will make more profit and be able to satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Cecilia, but she feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. 

Cecilia believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals. She believes that the extra income will allow a permanent change to her life, and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Cecilia to repay back the loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
La industria del entretenimiento es amplia y su consumo es masivo. Es por esta razón que Manuel se dedica a la compra y venta de CD`s musicales para satisfacer las necesidades de entretenimiento de sus clientes. Él agradece a Kiva y Mi Crédito ya que con su primera solicitud pudo invertir más en su negocio y ofrecer nuevos productos como son los anteojos de lujo. 

Ahora Manuel solicita una vez más un crédito para reforzar su negocio y comprar más CD`s grabados, ya que la demanda de sus productos son altas. Por otra parte, él tiene la esperanza que con las ganancias que obtenga podrá mejorar las condiciones de su casa y el cuarto de sus hijos. Al cancelar este nuevo préstamo Manuel quiere obtener otro y así agrandar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The entertainment industry is broad and its consumption is massive. For this reason Manuel makes a living buying and selling music CD's in order to satisfy the entertainment needs of his clients. He is very grateful to Kiva and Mi Crédito that he has already been able to use his first loan to invest more in his store and offer new products such as luxury sunglasses. 

Now Manuel is asking for a loan again in order to strengthen his business and buy more CD's, since the demand of his products is high. Moreover, he hopes that with the earnings that he obtains he can improve the conditions of his house and the room of his children. After paying off this new loan, Manuel wants to obtain another and continue to expand his store.

loans.use: to strengthen his business and buy more CD's.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. У Назиры среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, около 4 лет. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Назиры, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает картофель для реализации. Также у Назиры в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы с телятами. Ежемесячный доход от реализации сельскохозяйственной экологически чистой продукции, в том числе молока составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Назира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Назира намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и позволит отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Nazira is 52 years old, married and together with husband, raised 3 children. Nazira has a secondary education, and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for about 4 years. Thanks to her persistence, drive and hard work, today Nazira has 1.0 hectare of owned land, where she grows potatoes for sale. Also, Nazira's farm contains 2 dairy cows with calves. The monthly profit from selling agricultural, ecologically clean products, including milk, amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). Nazira requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her milk sales. Nazira intends to expand her business, which will undoubtedly lead to increasing her family's capital and allow her to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase sales of ecologically clean milk

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
This is Silvana a 27-year-old married mother of three; the oldest is 8 and the youngest is 2. She is being photographed in front of their family house.

Silvana is seeking your financial help to buy tools for her husband, who is a barber, and also pay some of the rent for the shop because recently they moved to a larger space. 

Silvana has some skills as well with hair, yet since she has very young children, she cannot fully practice on her own; thus, she is a stay-at-home mother and helps her husband as well, who makes approximately $550/month. His mother, who lives with them, receives a retirement pension of about $140/month, and there is also some financial assistance of $60/month.

loans.use: To pay for the rental of a barber shop that her husband operates and also to buy the necessary tools for his profession

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. Sinat is 35 years old and married. She has two dependent children who are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 17 years while her husband works as a construction worker. The current business earns her about 44,000 KHR per day. 

Sinath has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and construction equipment for supporting her husband’s business. She hopes to make more rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a divorced mother of two sons, 24 and 18, who are currently living with her and working for pay of $220/month each. Vera is talented also at handcrafts. She crochets and does other embroideries; she sells them and makes some little money here and there, but nothing steady. 

The reason why Vera is requesting this loan is because she has to pay some electricity bills that are in arrears. Kindly note that the company that dealt with the electricity here in Albania reached failure in its operations; thus, this created a mess. Some households sometimes never received the bills to know how much they owed, while others were overcharged and some did not have to pay at all. 

The company has got better leadership now, and things seem to be heading in the right direction, fortunately.

loans.use: to pay for arrears of electricity and water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Applegate Group

texts.en:
Applegate group is comprised of four mothers doing their small businesses in Harare, Zimbabwe.  Elizabeth is one such active married mother of four going to school. She is a tailor working in Harare Central Business District, selling products in residential areas and wholesaling to retailers in different retail markets.
She started working with one domestic hand sewing machine and has since managed to buy two industrial electric sewing machines. From her first loan, she has grown from just doing tailoring as a hobby into a business. This was a result of financing from Thrive, trainings on business management and the support she got from her group members in the form of ideas, encouragement and savings. Her business is growing well and she is looking forward to improve her stocking quantities as she is now faced with higher demand for her products. This is largely due to the fact that it is proving less affordable for the public to buy school uniforms from renowned school uniform suppliers. She has now employed two people to help her increase supply.
A loan amount of $800 will help her improve her business and become a reliable school uniforms supplier.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gunash

texts.en:
Gunash is a 42-year-old married IDP (Internally Displaced Person). Her husband is a labourer because it's hard for refugees to find a good job. They have a son and a daughter and live in an IDP settlement. The main income for the family comes from gardening. Gunash has a small garden and grows some fruits and greens there. Then she sells them in front of her house every day and earns 158 AZN monthly. Some local cafes buy her harvest because it is always fresh, tasty and grown without any pesticides.

Gunash knows how to grow a fresh and healthy harvest because she has worked in this field for 18 years. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools and fertilizers. She wants to take care of her garden properly because this is the only way for the family's income.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 21-year-old, married woman who has worked as a tutor for the past four years to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Zahra is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is trying hard to develop her business, thus she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a car, which will help her move easily to her students' houses.

Zahra hopes to further expand her business in the future, to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car, which will help her move easily to her students' houses.

loans.name: Fiaz

texts.en: Fiaz has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her milk sales to gain more profits.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгуль 34 года, замужем, 4 детей, образование среднее. С 1993 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Бактыгуль имеет 2 коровы. Также на 0,13 ГА собственной земли она выращивает кукурузу. Бактыгуль знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгуль обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Бактыгуль намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Baktygul is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a secondary education. She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1993, and currently has 2 cows. Baktygul also grows corn on 0.13 hectares of owned land. Baktygul knows the aspects of running an agricultural business well and can invest money properly. Her combined monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Baktygul requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls for fattening up and resale. Baktygul intends to increase her livestock headcount, and the earnings from the loan will allow her to save money for house repairs.

loans.use: tto buy bulls for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a horse-raising business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her horse.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her horse.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 55 years old, a married woman. She is a mother of three children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. After raising small animals for a year or two, she sells them in the local market with the support of her husband. 

For the improvement of her business, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.ru: Нурлану 28 лет, женат, отец 2 детей. С 2010 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Нурлана, на сегодняшний день у него есть 2 коровы, лошадь и 20 овец. В наличии есть 3,0 ГА поливной земли, где Рысбек выращивает клевер для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурлан обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Nurlan is 28 years old, married and a father of 2 children. He has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2010. Thanks to Nurlan's hard work, today he has 2 cows, a horse and 20 sheep. He also has 3.0 hectares of irrigated land, where he grows clover for sale. In order to further develop his business, Nurlan requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a horse. He plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding his business and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a horse in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 46 years old and lives in Mundri. He operates a business in Mundri. He started his shop in 2000 using his own loan. He desires to expand and develop his business using facility. He will use the loan to buy more goods like airtime and clear cream oil to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the customers.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: Gulzar is a 39-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has five buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has four children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 25 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do the maintenance on his taxi. 

Therefore Nighat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nighat's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Nighat  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Nighat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 20-year-old single man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. Bashar works in a coffee shop where he earns a very low income. He would like to improve himself and also his family's living conditions. Bashar is also a student in a local university where he studies English literature.
Bashar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Bashar will be able to pay the urgent expenses he has.
Bashar appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Florelyn

texts.en:
Florelyn is a married woman with two children, both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florelyn is 24 years old.

Florelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Florelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Florelyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Florelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Editha has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 51 years old and has four children who are in school.

Emelinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Emelinda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Teresa's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Teresa, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 49 years old, married, and has four children. Teresa has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Teresa isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life, due to better nutrition. 

This year, Teresa will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Using this loan, Teresa's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and they will use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is 52 years old and married. One of her sons has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Irshad  has applied for a loan of 45000 PKR, for her son. He wants to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Irshad  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with auto spare parts

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
"Mary is a 58-year-old proud mother of 7 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in the Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mary described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with the One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 27-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children. She has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She makes a good amount of income to bear her household expenditures. For the improvement of her business, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Kachere Group

texts.en:
Amina thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to expand her business by purchasing different commodities for her grocery store and this also helped her to increase her profits. She used the profits made to overcome some of the problems that her family was facing such as inadequate food, poor clothing and lack of shelter.

Amina would like to obtain another loan in order to open a wholesale store. She plans to build a better house for her children and hopes to send her children to private schools. The profits from the previous loans have helped her to become more independent than she was before.

loans.use: to buy items for her wholesale sales.

loans.name: Attiqa

texts.en: Attiqa is 33 years old and a hardworking woman who has two children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Attiqa’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Attiqa has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread and lace to meet the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 44-year-old married woman. 

Shamim is involved in the business of trading cloth. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and then sells them to customers in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Shamim has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR with which she plans to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors. This loan will help her business with a boost in earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Jose Noel
