texts.es: EL SEÑOR ES HABITANTE DE CHINANDEGA CUENTA CON UN TALLER DESDE HACE 30 AÑOS DE MECANICA EN EL CUAL REALIZAN REPARACIONES A MOTOCIERRA Y TODO TIPO DE MAQUINARIA SU NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN EL BARRIO DE SANTA ANA EN EL CUAL BRINDA ATENCION AL PUBLICO EN GENERAL EL SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA LA COMPRA DE HERRAMIENTAS PARA SU TRABAJO Y ASI PODER BRINDAR UNA MEJOR ATENCION A SUS CLIENTES ES UN HOMBRE TRABAJADOR QUE INICIA SUS LABORES DESDE LAS 7:00 AM A LAS 6:00 PM DE LUNES A DOMINGO EL SE EFUERZA PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS 4 HIJOS QUE ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
texts.en:
Jose Noel is a resident of Chinandega and has operated a mechanical repair shop for the last 30 years. He repairs all types of machinery in his shop, located in the Santa Ana neighborhood, where he offers his services to the public in general. 

Jose Noel is seeking financing to purchase tools for his work and, thus, to be able to offer better customer service. He is a hard-working man who works from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm, from Monday to Sunday. He is putting forth great effort to advance his four children, all of whom are of school age.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles and chainsaws.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz is a 57-year-old woman. She is married and has a son and three daughters. Her husband is a labourer and helps the family as much as he can but their main income comes from livestock. Solmaz keeps sheep. She raises them, fattens and then sells them or uses their wool in order to sew warm jackets, gloves, blankets; she sells these too. Her daughters help her in this.

She has been a farmer for 20 years and has good skills. But her monthly income is only 170 AZN and this money doesn't cover big parts of the family's needs. Solmaz's livestock was weak last year and it's productivity has fallen. Now she applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy  three new sheep and recover productivity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy three new sheep and recover productivity of livestock.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old with one children in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries.

loans.name: Om Dawod Group

texts.en:
Gariba is a 25-year-old married mother of 3 children. She lives with her family in a humble house while her husband is working outside of the country. 

Gariba is the leader of Om Dawod Group which consists of 4 women from Hodeidah, Yemen. Together, they are requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. 

Because the low amount that Gariba's husband sends home each month is not enough to cover their daily expenses, she decided to begin a small business selling women's clothing door-to-door. 

One of Gariba's biggest problems is the lack of a financial support. For this reason, she is requesting her loan portion of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase inventory of women's clothing.  

With her business profits, Gariba hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing to resell.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 27 years old, and is a single, vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 52-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Beatrice has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Beatrice described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Beatrice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Safia is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth.

loans.name: Celso Arquimides

texts.es: Celso de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el trabaja como jornal desde hace 15 años cerca de su casa, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que ganan en su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir más seguros.
texts.en: Celso, 41, lives in his own house with his wife.  He has been working as a day laborer near his house for 15 years.  He wants to improve his home, building a perimeter wall in the place that is shown in the photograph.  But he cannot accomplish this with what he earns from his work, so he is requesting a loan.  It is for the purchase of cement, sand, brick, and  iron; and for paying the cost of labor, so that he and his family may live more securely.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, and iron; and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María, de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 de ellos aún viven en la casa con María.

María, se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino, cerdos y aves de corral, desde hace muchos años, el manejo de estos animales lo aprendió de sus padres y a la vez decidió realizar estas tareas, como una forma de ganarse la vida, sus animales los tiene cerca de su vivienda.

El crédito lo ocupará para comprar concentrado, harinilla, medicamentos, entre otros; él espera poder vender algunos animales a buen precio, despues de varios meses y generar buenos ingresos para su familia.

Lo que más desea María, es darle a sus hijos una buena educación, que no les falte nada y que un día lleguen hacer personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years of age and studied to the fourth grade. She is married and her husband is dedicated to agriculture, cultivating basic grains. They have five children, four of whom still live at home with her.

Maria raises cattle, pigs, and corral birds. She learned to manage these animals many years ago from her parents. Maria decided to undertake these tasks as a way of earning her living. She keeps the livestock near her house.

The loan will be used to buy livestock feed, middlings, and livestock medicines, among other items. After various months, Maria hopes to be able to sell some animals at a good price and generate good income for her family.

What Maria most desires is to offer her children a good education, and for them to lack nothing, so that one day, they can become people who will benefit society.

loans.use: purchase cattle food, middlings, and livestock medicines, among other inputs.

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en:
Naomi is a 42-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Naomi has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Naomi described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Naomi’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a humble farmer who goes to work on his farm every morning. He is dedicated in full to his work. This man only thinks about going forward and delivering good produce. He knows that many people consume his farm products, and because of this, he makes sure his products are pure and of good quality. He is a 28-year-old farmer from Chemalul village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He lives with his wife and children on a small piece of land where he keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops. For 10 years, his primary sources of income have been milk and produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases. Christopher made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime this month, he applied for a loan to expand his farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Christopher's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Albert's Group

texts.en:
Albert is a 65-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Albert has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Albert described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, along with fertilizer and maize seed, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Albert’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Merinciana's Group

texts.en:
Merinciana's Group is made up of 12 farmers in Teso District in Kenya. The group's leader is Merinciana, who is pictured above. She is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Merinciana isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life change, especially in the sense that she has earned more profits from each harvest ever since. 

This year, Merinciana will not only receive fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Merinciana's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and receive enough farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as receive hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac's Group is made up of 13 farmers from Matete District in Kenya. The group is being represented by its leader Isaac who is pictured above. He is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has been a farmer for 13 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Isaac isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life change, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

This year, Isaac will not only receive fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but he will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about the addition of a solar light since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save money.

Using this loan, Isaac's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and receive enough farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as receive hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish women's clothes, incense and perfume to resell them door to door.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia is 28 years old and lives in a house with her father in Lui. She has earned a living for one year as a farmer growing sorghum she sells in markets. A loan of 300 SSP would help her to do more work by enabling her to buy manure, seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for the rent and labor of the land.

loans.use: To buy manure, seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for the rent and labor of the land

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en:
Zaitoon is a 47-year-old married mother who has been running a business with her husband for many years trading cattle. She looks after the goats and is responsible for providing them with food, while her husband sells them to customers at different locations. 

Zaitoon and her husband are happily running their business together in order to support their family. They have 7 children, 5 of whom are in school. 

However, Zaitoon and her husband need to earn much more so they can meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing, and education costs. 

In order to earn greater profits, Zaitoon has requested a 55,000 PKR loan to buy more goats so they can cater to more customers.

loans.use: to buy more goats in order to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh is a 19-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. Sami's father works in the public sector where he earns a low income. Sameh is a student in a local collage where he studies air conditioning maintenance.
Sameh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the collage installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Sameh will be able to complete his study faster.
Sameh appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the collage installments for this semester.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small house. Mohammad's sister works in the public sector where she earns a low salary. This is the only source of income to the family. Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies Information technology.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to pay the urgent expenses he has.
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Layal

texts.en:
Layal is a 27-year-old married mother of two children who has worked as an accountant for the last six years. She has a limited salary with which to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.
Layal is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying her best to improve her family's living conditions for they are her priority. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house through buying new furniture to make the place healthier for her children. 
Layal hopes to open her own accounting business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house through buying new furniture

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. Mohammad's father is a construction worker where he earns a low and unstable income. Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies Business administration.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his study faster.
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es: Juan vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside ya tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Juan lives in his own house with his wife and his 3 children. For 20 years he has grown corn and sorghum. He sells his products in the area where he lives. He has lots of clients due to the quality of his products. He is requesting a new loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides to improve his land shown in the photograph. His sales have been good and he can increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides and improve the land.

loans.name: Petronila's Group

texts.en:
Petronila is 45 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Petronila is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Petronila started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Petronila’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Mirna Ruth

texts.es: Mirna de 35 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) desde hace 15 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, Mirna esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
35-year old Mirna is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her two daughters and has earned her living growing crops such as maize and beans for fifteen years. When the harvest is completed, she stores the grains and beans in barns as shown in the photograph.

Mirna is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, pesticide, herbicide etc. so she can continue farming and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, compost, pesticide, herbicide etc

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene is 55 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Irene has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Irene also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Irene's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
"Mary is a 46-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Mary has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Mary described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase necessary furniture such as a bed.

loans.name: Roselyne's Group

texts.en:
"Roselyne's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Roselyne, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 48 years old, is married and has 4 children. Roselyne has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Roselyne isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, Roselyne will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Using this loan, Roselyne's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.25 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Julius's Group

texts.en:
Julius's Group is formed by ten farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Julius, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 33 years old, married, and has four children. Julius has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hard-working individual.

Julius isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2012 and he has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. 

This year, Julius will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Julius's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a very responsible person who is 28 years old, living in Hajah city, Yemen. He is a married man and a father of five children. He works as a solider with a small salary. He has saved part of his small salary and bought a piece of land to build a small house on that land. This cost him a lot of money. Unfortunately, he couldn't complete building the rest of the house as well as make the necessary renovations to prepare it for living. Therefore, he turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank and took out a loan of 100,000 YER to purchase windows and doors for his new house in order to live with his family. 
Mohammed hopes to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To Purchase the necessary construction to renovate the house.

loans.name: Atiya

texts.en:
Atiya is a 52-year-old married mother of six children and has worked in her mobile phones shop for two years. 

She also sells clothes from her house to help her husband cover the increasing living expenses of their beloved kids.

She is a sacrificing mother and an ambitious woman who is working hard to develop her business. 

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones and their accessories, along with prepaid mobile cards. 

This loan will satisfy Atiya's customers and help her increase her income.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future in order to stay capable of providing her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones and their accessories, along with prepaid mobile cards.

loans.name: Isakh

texts.en:
Isakh is a 61-year-old laborer. He is a refugee, as is his wife, and they have two daughters and a son. The family lives in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Isakh is a laborer in order to earn additional money for the family, but his main earnings come from livestock. He keeps small sheep and then fattens them. When they are grown, he sells them or their wool. This brings him about 200AZN monthly, but that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Isakh loves his job very much, and he takes care of the sheep properly. Many local and neighboring restaurants buy sheep from Isakh because they are always healthy and good. 

He wants to expand his business because he needs more earnings for the family. He applied for a 1,200AZN loan in order to repair the sheep stall because it is very old and broken.

loans.use: to repair the sheep stall because it is very old and broken.

loans.name: Guadalupe Roxana Antonia

texts.es: Guadalupe de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia  con su esposo, ella se dedica  a la crianza de gallina desde hace 2 años, comercializa los productos en los  alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, Guadalupe está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollo, vitaminas y concentrado para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
57-year old Guadalupe lives in her own house with her husband. She has earned her living raising chickens for two years and sells them in nearby communities. With the income she earns, she manages to pay for household expenses.

Guadalupe is seeking a loan to buy more chickens, vitamins, and special feed so she can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy more chickens, vitamins, and special feed

loans.name: Ibtehal

texts.en:
Ibtehal is a 31-year-old single lady from Jenin city. Her father works as an employee in a local firm; he gets a very low income. Ibtehal is a student in a local university especiallized in social science. She would like to get the BA degree and find a job in the future.

Ibtehal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Ibtehal will be able to read online articles and write her reports easily.

Ibtehal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Idi's Group

texts.en:
Idi, pictured above, has been a farmer for 15 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 8 farmers in Teso District. He is 48 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Idi likes to think of himself as a very resourceful person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learned a lot from farming trainings. Idi plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Idi’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy coffee husks to use as mulch.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 37-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales, with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. 

She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves

loans.name: Juana Francis

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CUENTA CON UN COMEDOR EN EL SECTOR DEL BISNE DESDE HACE 30 AÑOS EN EL CUAL SE ELABORAN DIFERENTES PLATILLOS COMO CARNE BAHO,POLLO ASADO, CARNE ASASDA DE RES Y CERDO , GALLO PINTO CON QUESO Y MADURO FRITO INICIA UN DIA DE TRABAJO DESDE LAS 6:00 AM Y FINALIZA A LA 5:00 PM ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA , EMPRENDEDORA QUE DE LUNES A DOMINGO TRABAJA EN SU NEGOCIO PARA PODER SACAR ADELANTE A SU FAMILIA ELLA SOLICITA EL FINANCIAMIENTO PARA LA COMPRA DE VERDURAS Y ESPECIES PARA REALIZAR SUS PLATILLOS.
texts.en: Juana has had an eatery in the Bisne area for 30 years. She makes various dishes like roast chicken, roast beef, roast ham, and baked hen with cheese and fries. She starts her work day at 6 am and ends at 5 pm. She is a hard-working woman and enterprising. She works every day of the week in order to provide for her family. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of vegetables and spices for making her dishes.

loans.use: to sell food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ghoroub

texts.en:
Ghoroub is a 22-year-old single lady who opened her grocery shop a year ago to cover her needs and expenses and to help her poor family.

She is a young, ambitious lady who gained a good reputation among her region in a short period of time. She is trying desperately and working hard to develop her business.

Today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with new requested products to satisfy her customers' needs.

Ghoroub hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new requested products to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza e bueyes desde hace 12 años,  y es así como logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Don Manuel quiere invertir en la compra de mas bueyes pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para poder comprar lo dicho anteriormente y así poder continuar con la crianza para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Manuel is 51 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked raising and oxen for 12 years, which has allowed him to pay for his living expenses. Don Manuel wants to invest in buying more oxen, but does not have enough capital. So, he has applied for a loan through INTEGRAL to make the described purchase, which will allow him to continue breeding oxen, which will provide him with economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more oxen.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos desde hace 13 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared que muestra en la fotografía que está hecha de adobe y está muy dañada y encementando, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para podre realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, arena, hierro, cemento y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her son. She has sold snacks for 13 years. With her earnings, she has succeeded in paying for some household expenses. 

She wants to improve her home by building a wall, which is shown in the photo. It is made of adobe and is very damaged, and she wants to remake it with cement. With her earnings from her sales, however, she doesn’t have enough money to be able to build the wall. For this reason, she requests a loan to buy bricks, sand, iron, and cement and to pay for workers for the job. This will allow her family and her to live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, iron, and cement and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es: Juan vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, y con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante junto con su familia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en: Juan lives at home with his wife and two children. He has grown corn and sorghum for several years and sells his products in different markets that are close to his home. The profits that he makes allows his family to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pest control supplies, weed-killer, and other supplies, as shown in the photo. These will allow him to continue working and provide himself and his family with economic security.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pest control supplies, weed-killer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy puppies

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is an ambitious Mexican farmer who decided to invest in a biodigester in order to take advantage of her cows' manure and produce her own biogas and biofertilizer. By inputting her animals' waste in the system, the natural methanisation process will transform the manure into methane-rich biogas, which will be connected to the cookstove and the boiler in her house. In addition, the bacteria in the biodigester produce an organic and potent fertilizer that will allow Flora to increase the yield of her corn field in a natural way. 

Flora will progressively displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers she used to buy, saving money and protecting the environment by eliminating fossil fuels from her operations. The untreated waste will not contaminate underground water sources anymore, nor emit greenhouse gases. With her savings, Flora plans to buy more cows and invest in improving the infrastructure on her farm to maintain good living conditions for her animals. This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and has 9 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group made up of 6 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds.

Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Jane also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will be able to receive a total of 3 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 13 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Joyce will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also two solar lights. 

Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Joyce plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Joyce’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Megi

texts.en:
Megi, 45 years old, is a married woman from Tbilisi. She lives with her husband and mother, who gets a monthly pension from the local government. Megi's husband has his own private activity and generates some income that is the only source of income for the family. In spite of her high education, Megi was unable to find any stable job, so she decided to become involved in her own business and start trading. She couldn’t receive a loan from local financial institutions because of their requirements for business experience or stable revenue. The Start Up program, a joint product of Kiva and Credo, allows people to get a chance to start or re-start businesses. 

According to the above mentioned situation, Megi was approved for a loan of 600 USD, which she plans to use for purchasing bed linens, which she will start selling in her community. She will get the chance to do her bit for her family's welfare and to generate some income. Megi will be really grateful for being given the chance to create her own business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a sales business with linens and generate her own income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase furniture for his home.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix es un hombre que se destaca por su amabilidad y es muy disciplinado en sus actividades, él es casado tiene 39 años y tiene una bonita familia de 6 hijos, esta familia vive en el municipio de San José Chacayá. 

Félix para el sostenimiento de su familia dese hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura el cultiva diversidad de verduras  y a la vez compra verduras por mayor y los revende, de esta manera Félix genera su economía, él es muy entregado al trabajo además de esta actividad, él también trabaja como jornalero con sus vecinos de la comunidad, ya que esto le favorece para complementar los gastos que necesita su familia.
 
Félix para seguir generando más ingresos, él solicita un prestamo de cinco mil quinientos quetzales, que le servirá para comprar abono, semillas y fungicidas para sus cultivos, además de esto parte del préstamo lo utilizara para comprar verduras al por mayor. Félix  es una persona muy perseverante  y lo que  él sueña es que con las ganancias pueda comprar un lote de terreno para luego construir una casa más y en un lugar más céntrico ya que él vive lejano de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Felix is a man who stands out because of his kindness, and he is very disciplined in his work. He is married, is 39 years old, and has a beautiful family with 6 children. This family lives in the municipality of San José Chacayá.

To support his family, Felix has spent 20 years working in agriculture, growing many different vegetables. At the same time, he buys vegetables wholesale and resells them. In this way, Felix makes money. He is very dedicated to this work. He also works as a day laborer, helping his neighbors in the community. This helps him by complementing the expenses his family needs.

To continue generating more money, Felix requests a loan for 5500 quetzales, which will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds, and fungicides for his crops. Additionally, part of the loan will be used to buy vegetables wholesale. Felix is a very persevering person, and he dreams that with his earnings he will be able to buy a lot of land and then construct another house in a more central location, since he currently lives far from the community.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Melvin Javier

texts.es:
Melvin es un joven de tan solo 20 años, él es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Chaquijya. 
Melvin es un muchacho muy responsable en su trabajo, él para la generación de su economía trabaja para una tienda de abarrotes y especies, pues el trabajo lo ejerce dentro de su comunidad y esto es ventajoso para Melvin ya que no hace inversiones extras para su movilización.  
Melvin a pesar de ser muy chico él siempre vive pensando en su futuro y por ser disciplinado ha logrado alcanzar algunas metas en la vida,  pues ahora  para seguir avanzando en sus planes, él está buscando un prestamo en ADICLA de cinco mil quetzales que le servirá para comprar materiales tales como: cemento, blocks e inodoro para  concluir  los acabados de su casa,  Melvin tiene la certeza de conseguir el prestamo que tanto lo necesita para que en poco tiempo pueda tener su casa tal como lo ha soñado tener. 
Los sueños de Melvin es seguir  trabajando con honestidad en la tienda, para adquirir experiencia y en un futuro él pueda tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Melvin is a young man of only 20 years. He is single and lives with his parents and brothers in a community of Chaquijya. 
Melvin is very responsible in his work. To make a living he works at a grocery store in his community, and this is advantageous for him because he doesn't have to pay more for his transportation.
Despite being very young, he is always thinking of the future. Because he is disciplined, he has been able to reach some goals in life. Now in order to move forward with his plans he is requesting a loan of 5 000 quetzals from ADICLA. He will use this to buy materials such as cement, blocks, and a toilet to finish building his house.
Melvin will definitely repay this loan. He needs it very much so that he can have his home as he has always dreamed in little time.
His dreams are to continue working honestly in the store in order to gain experience so that in the future he can have his own business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a smaller sized poly tank to store more water and sell to clients when there is a water shortage.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA MARIA CUENTA CON UN COMEDOR DE COMIDA UBICADO EN EL MERCADITO DE CHINANDEGA DESE HACE 31 AÑOS ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE UNA HIJA QUE SE ENCUENTRA ESTUDIANDO ACTUALMENTE LA SEÑORA SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA EL NEGOCIO LA SEÑORA OBTIENE MAS INGRESO EN SU GANANCIA AL COMPRAR POR MAYOR LOS PRODUCTOS POR QUE LE OFRECEN MEJOR PRECIO ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA QUE LUCHA POR SACAR ADELANTE A SU HIJA PARA QUE TERMINE SUS ESTUDIOS.

INICIA UN DIA DE TRABAJO DESDE LAS 6: 00 AM PREPARANDO LOS DESAYUDOS DE SUS CLIENTES Y FINANLIZA A LAS 4:00 PM DE LUNES A DOMIGO.
texts.en:
Señora María has had a cafeteria in a small market in Chinandega for 31 years.  She is a single mother with a daughter who is studying in school.  

This lady is requesting a loan for the purchase of raw materials for the business, as she earns more income when she buys the products wholesale because they are offered at better prices.  

She is a hard-working woman who fights to provide for her daughter so that she may complete her education.  She works from Monday to Sunday, starting at 6:00 A.M., preparing breakfast for her customers; and she finishes at 4:00 P.M.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like rice, oil, vegetables and beans, for making meals.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 50 years old, married, and has five children; two children are in school.

Marcelina is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcelina has been in this business for 25 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 57 years old and married, with four children. With one child in school, Belen works very hard to provide for them.

Belen runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, coffee, canned goods, and groceries.

Belen has been in this business for one year and she sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, soft drinks, bread, and junk food. 

In the future, Belen would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, coffee, canned goods, and groceries.

loans.name: Tipindule Group

texts.en:
Jessy greatly appreciates Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to purchase chicken feed and other needed materials for her business. 

She is now able to send her children to school and to provide her family with food three times a day. Jessy also greatly testifies that obtaining the loan has helped her to improve her family's living standards. 

She wants to obtain another loan in order to expand her business by building a better kraal (enclosure) for her chickens as more chickens die during the rainy seasons. She also wants to buy other necessities for her business.

She plans to open a grocery store and hopes to fully alleviate her household's level of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and build a better kraal.

loans.name: Pilister

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Pilister does not boast of any academic papers from any agricultural institute, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Siongiroi area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. 

She is happily married, and together with her handsome husband, they are blessed with a lovely family. 

For the past 10 years Pilister has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. 

Pilister has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up. 

Pilister, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. 

Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Pilister said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans, and their interest rate is low and on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. 

She hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk business by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change Pilister's life and will secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, 67 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa realiza labores domesticas en su casa, viven con una hija y dos nietos.

José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace muchos años, todo lo aprendió gracias a sus padres; José, tiene que caminar medio kilómetro para llegar al terreno donde tiene sus cultivos.

Con el presente crédito José, comprará insumos agricolas para sembrar y aumentar sus cultivos, para lograr una mayor cosecha y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.

El sueno de José, es que sus nietos aprendan muy bien a sembrar maíz, para que tengan una fuente de ingresos segura.
texts.en:
Jose is 67 years old. He studied until third grade. He is married, and his wife does housework in their home. They live with one daughter and two grandchildren. 

Jose has been dedicated to growing corn for many years. He learned everything he knows thanks to his parents. Jose has to walk half a kilometer to arrive at the land where his crops are.

With the loan, Jose will buy agricultural supplies to sow and increase his crops. This will help him succeed with a better harvest and, in this way, will increase his income.

Jose’s dream is for his two grandchildren to learn how to grow corn very well, so that they can have a secure source of income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to sow and increase his crops.

loans.name: Gusein

texts.en:
Gusein is a 39-year-old hardworking man from the village of Mamkhuti. He lives with his wife and pensioner mother. Gusein and his wife are involved in agricultural activity. In particular, they cultivate a plot of agricultural land, where they harvest beans and unions. They sell agricultural products at the local market.  

Gusein has a great desire to expand the variety of trading products and wants to start producing sausage. He requested a loan for purchasing a special machine and will then start selling sausage. 

The Startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Gusein's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 GEL.

Gusein thinks this business will be profitable, as the demand is high and he will have a significant portion of the local market share. 

Gusein and his wife rely on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate your support and kindness, as their living conditions will significantly improve because of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sausage-making machine and start selling sausage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Dominga Gloria

texts.es:
Dominga,  de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, tiene una hija, actualmente, viven  en la casa de sus padres.

Dominga, se dedica al cultivar la tierra y a vender comida típica,  por las tardes se dedica a vender pupusas, está actividad la aprendió cuando le ayudaba a una amiga, luego ella tomó la iniciativa de colocar su propio negocio, ahora ella trabaja en estas actividades, con la ayuda de una de sus hermanas.

Dominga, utilizará el financiamiento, para comprar fertilizantes, abono y veneno para preparar la tierra, donde sembrará maíz, otra parte quiere invertirla para comprar una plancha más grande y así mismo realizará la compra de dos juegos de mesas y sillas plásticas, para ofrecerles una mejor comodidad a sus clientes.

Dominga, desea que aumentar la cantidad de clientes que tiene, ya que esto le permitirá obtener más ingresos y le dará la oportunidad de ofrecer a su familia, una mejor calidad de vida, en especial a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Dominga is 29 years old and studied up to Grade 5. She is married and her spouse works in agriculture. She has a daughter and currently lives in her parents house.

Dominga works cultivating the land and selling traditional food. In the evenings she sells pupusas. She learned this business helping a friend. Later she took the initiative to open her own business. Now she works in this business with the help of one of her sisters.

Dominga will use the loan to buy fertilizer, manure and poison to prepare the land where she grows corn. She will invest another part of the loan to buy a larger grill and two sets of tables and plastic chairs to offer her clients more comfort. Dominga wants to increase the number of clients that she has as this would allow her to get more income and give her the chance of providing her family with a higher quality of living, especially for her young daughter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and poison to prepare the land.

loans.name: Yofesi

texts.en: Yofeesi is a married man aged 43 and lives in Kagadi Uganda where he operates a carpentry workshop, practices farming and owns a rental to earn income to support his family. He is honest and his dream is to create another business to increase his household income, though challenged by insufficient capital. Yofeesi is asking for a loan to buy additional timber for furniture making.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: Bellaflor

texts.en:
Bellaflor is 49 years old and has five children. She is widowed and has two children who are in school.

Bellaflor is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bellaflor has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bellaflor would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and ceramic tile, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Mryna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mryna is 36 years old and three of her children are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mryna requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Mryna has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Mryna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 48 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Perlita requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Perlita has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 32 years old, married, and a mother of one child. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy tailoring materials, such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, in order to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee un molino de nixtamal y venta de mariscos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico, pero no tiene de suficiente capital para realizarlo por es razón solicita nuevamente un crédito pero en esta ocasión es para la compra de cemento, cerámica y pago de mano de obra y así poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives in her own house with her husband.  She owns a mill for grinding nixtamal [cooked corn], and a small seafood shop.  With what she earns from her work, and with her husband’s help, they manage to move forward.  

She wants to improve their home by laying a ceramic tile floor, but she does not have enough capital do it, which is why she is requesting another loan.  On this occasion it is for the purchase of cement and ceramic tile, and to pay for labor to improve their home.

loans.use: to purchase cement and ceramic tile, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa , la joven vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman, whose face is pixelated because she is 29 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has been making a living for five years in agriculture cultivating corn.  She sells her products in different markets close to her house.  The young woman lives in her own house with her children.
She is requesting a loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, blight control, etc. as shown in the photograph in order to continue with her work and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, blight control, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is married and has two children. She is 34 years old and lives in Minlasag, Sibutad. She earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She now has been in this business for about 3 years and is well known for the nice quality of services she offers. She already has manicure sets but wants to use the loan to purchase new manicure sets to be more efficient in her services she supplies. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 1,000 per month. Rowena is seeking a PHP 3,000 loan. She has never had a delinquency in her previous loans. Rowena is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy new manicure sets

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita lives in Tuburan, Aloran. She is married and gifted with four children. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other agricultural commodities. Warlita has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member helps her husband plowing the rice field, planting corn and a variety of agricultural commodities. 
In need of additional working capital, Warlita decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 4,000 to buy farm inputs.
Warlita has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to cope the needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 46 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Angelina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, shampoo, and groceries.

Angelina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, eggs, soap powder, oil, vinegar, soy sauce, and toothpaste.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Juveline

texts.en:
Juveline runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities such as biscuits, chips, candies, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, soap and other goods. She is a 25-year-old married woman with one young dependent. Aside from that, she is also engaged in fishing and sells fish. She hails from Talibon, Bohol. 

Juveline has requested  for a loan  to buy assorted stocks for the store and purchase a pump boat. These  materials will help her filled her store with variety of stocks and improve her ongoing catch. She could now attract more customers and increase her sales.

 In the future, Juveline dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: restock her store & purchase a boat

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, 48, lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and is blessed with four children. Evangeline and her husband are both farmers.  They raised their family doing this type of activity. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities to continue putting bread on the table in her home. In need of additional working capital, Evangeline decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 5,000 to pay for labor cost and land preparation on her rice farm and buying of fertilizer and herbicides to increase crop yield.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, Evangeline has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Evangeline is very thankful when all her financing needs were supported by PMPC. She hopes to own a land tractor someday for a fast and easy cultivation of her rice land.

loans.use: pay for farm labor cost

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn earns an income through selling various seafood like shells, seaweeds and fish. She also produces shrimp pastes to sell. 

Carolyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital to purchase more stock of a variety of seafood to expand her business and increase her production. She is on her way to repaying her loan from her new profits. 

Carolyn hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: buy seafood

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education from the co-op. She is a member in good standing and is very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She has a small piece of farm land near her home. 

Celerina is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 3,000. This loan is intended to buy rice fertilizer to increase crop yield. Celerina dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. Farming is the main source of her income. PMPC to Maryjane came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she requested another loan to pay for labor in seedbed preparation such as mounting of the beds, seed sowing, and to buy farm inputs. 

Maryjane perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family. In the future, she wants to buy a hectare of land to expand her farming activities for possible business opportunities.

loans.use: pay for farm labor

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE COMIDA DESDE HACE 20 AÑOS ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE UN A HIJA EN EDAD ESCOLAR ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA QUE INICIA UN DIA DE TRABAJO DESDE LAS 7:00 AM  ALA  4:00 PM ELLA VENDE DIFERENTES PLATILLOS DE COMIDA EN EL ALMUERZO ELLA SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA COMO ARROZ,ACEITE,FRIJOLES PARA LA PREPARACION DE SUS PLATILLOS.
texts.en:
This lady has a business where she has been selling food for the past 20 years. She is a single mother of a school age daughter. She is a hardworking woman who starts her day working at 7:00 AM until 4:00 PM. She sells different dishes for lunch. 

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as rice, oil, beans to prepare the dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Marycor

texts.en:
Marycor is 52 years old. She is married with three children and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Marycor has managed her rice farm. She also engages in palay-trading and a rice-retailing business. She mastered doing these types of activities with the help and support of her husband, to sustain their needs. 

She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2011. She is a hard-working mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family. 

Marycor requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, to increase production on her rice farm, and pay for sacks of 'palay' for rice retail. This will help her gain more income and provide her family with a good and decent life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, to increase production on her rice farm, and pay for sacks of 'palay' for rice retail.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina, 31, is married, with one school-age child. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for five years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the health needs and the education of her child. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income, due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her child or future children. 

Antonina's plan is to maintain her inventory, so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her family. She already availed of loans previously to purchase additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

location.town: Liloy-San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
From Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Leonora earns a living through her clothing sales. 

Leonora aims to have consistent and sufficient inventory to sell so she can provide for her family. 

For her capital needs, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative has stood by Leonora since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to beat the odds of business success with determination. Her family is her inspiration. 

To earn more income, Leonora has applied for a loan to purchase more inventory of clothing to sell. 

Leonora hopes to live comfortably, with her children being able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, con el pago que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante junto a su familia, el quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el patio de su vivienda que es el que muestra en la fotografía pero con lo que obtiene de sus trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita  un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir ms cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Miguel, 39, lives in his own home with his wife and two children.

 He works as a day laborer in a farm close to his house. He is able to support his family with his pay. 

He wants to improve his house by cementing his patio which is shown in the photograph. 

He does not earn enough to make this improvement which is why he is requesting a loan so he can buy cement, sand, iron and labor. 

This will allow him and his family to live cleaner and more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and labor.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marivic is 52 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Marivic has a buy-and-sell household products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.en:
Celestino owns a herd of sheep as well as poultry, and he used to collect the waste they produce on a daily basis to pile it up outside the farm, where it was emitting greenhouse gases, contaminating underground water sources, smelling bad and attracting flies.

By investing in his biodigester, he will be able to transform his animals' manure into precious and productive resources: biogas and organic fertilizer. These will be integrated in the activities on the farm, as the biogas will be connected to the cookstove and the boiler in the kitchen, while Celestino will apply the nutrient-rich fertilizer on his cornfield.

The expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers will become irrelevant for the farm's operations, turning it into a more sustainable place, where there is no waste or contamination and fossil fuels. Celestino plans to take advantage of the organic fertilizer to improve the yield of the fruit trees in his garden and plant more vegetables for his family's own consumption. With the savings he will make, he wants to buy more sheep and two calves.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a 10-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ursula Beatriz

texts.es: Úrsula de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando y pintando las paredes pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de arena, cemento, pintura y pago de mano de obra para que puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Ursula is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her son. She has been selling pupusas for several years, and she’s able to earn enough from her sales to cover household expenses. 

She wants to improve her home by plastering and painting the walls, but her earnings from her work are not enough to do it. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and paint, and to pay for labor, so that they may live in greater comfort and cleanliness.
.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, paint and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Liza Grace

texts.en:
Liza Grace is 46 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Liza Grace has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona muy amable, con esa característica se identifica con sus vecinos y familiares él tiene 62 años y vive con su familia en una comunidad de Sololá, Miguel para su  ingreso económico, desde siempre ha trabajado  como agricultor en su comunidad, le gusta hacer esta actividad porque convive con la naturaleza y es más  genera sus ingresos, él cultiva zanahoria y entre otras verduras, Miguel ha sido una de las personas que siempre ha trabajado con préstamos ya que él considera que de esa manera  ha logrado avanzar con sus planes logrando beneficio para su familia,  con el primer prestamo que obtuvo logro mejorar su cultivo y obtuvo buenas cosechas  y con las ganancias pudo remodelar una parte de su casa. 
Pues con este resultado Miguel nuevamente solicita un segundo prestamo que  le servirá para capital de trabajo, el uso seria compra de  semillas, fertilizantes y todo lo necesario para esperar una nueva cosecha, por  la experiencia adquirida en el primer prestamo este segundo le ira mejor  y seguirá avanzando con sus planes. El sueño de Miguel es seguir haciendo mejoras en su casa para que su familia tenga un lugar cómodo donde vivir.
texts.en:
Miguel's neighbors and family describe him as a very nice person. He is 62 and lives with his family in a community in Sololá.

Miguel has always worked as a farmer in his community. He likes this work because he is out in the nature and it generates his income. He grows carrots and other vegetables. 

Miguel is one of the people who has always worked with loans as he considers this has been the way he has been able to get ahead and support his family. 

With his first loan he was able to improve his crops and with the profits he was able to renovate part of his house. 

Miguel is requesting a second loan which will serve as working capital to buy seeds, fertilizer and anything else he will need for the new harvest. 

With the experience gained from the first loan, this second loan will go better for him and he will keep moving forward with his plans. 

Miguel's dream is to keep improving his house to that he and his family have a comfortable place to live in.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Noemi

texts.en:
Ma. Noemi is 43 years old and married with eight children.  With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Noemi runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Noemi would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: Maria está muy agradecida por el crédito brindado con el cual compro los diferentes insumos agrícolas como: fertilizante 12-24-12, abono, plaguicida, foliar entre otros los cuales ayudaron a que el grano de café arrojara los resultados esperados el cual salió grueso y pesado siendo esto beneficioso al momento de su venta obteniendo un buen precio sobre el mismo al momento de su venta. En esta ocasión ella solicita su segundo crédito a través de COMIXMUL para invertirlo nuevamente en sus cultivos de café abonar, limpiar y pagar la mano de obra que ayudara a la limpieza y recuperación de la planta ya que después de la temporada de corta las plantas quedan un poco maltratas y el terreno montoso. Maria necesita que se le dé un buen mantenimiento para que las plantas de café se fortalezcan y la flor no se le caiga así carguen bien y a su vez tener una buena cosecha este próximo año.
texts.en:
Maria appreciates the loan she received. She bought different types of farming supplies such as fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide etc. which helped produce the expected types of coffee beans. They were wide and heavy which helped her get a good price at selling time. 

Maria is now requesting her second loan through COMIXMUL to again invest in her coffee plants with fertilizer, cleaning and day labor who help with the cleaning and maintenance of the plants. 

After the harvest the plants and land are left in a bad condition. 

Maria needs to take care of the land in order for the coffee plants to grow strong and for the flower not to drop. 

This will allow the plants to grow well and to have a good harvest this coming year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and day labor to help with her coffee plants.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is a father of one school-age child and has worked as a driver for the past nine years. He is also doing carpentry works for additional earning.
