His business involves a motor for hire or public transport. He does this work to support his family. He asked a loan to pay for motor engine overhaul and repair. In the future, he hopes to own another unit of motor for hire and rental to increase his income and to be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay for motor engine overhaul and repair

location.town: Liloy-Villa C. Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 64 years old. She is married and has eleven children. 

She is a businesswoman from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, in the Philippines. In order to help the family, she engages in running a small retail store, selling assorted goods to her neighbors. 

Recently, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC, Carmencita wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store to serve more customers and be able to gain more profit to benefit her family, especially her grandchildren. 

She plans to save enough for the repair and expansion of their house.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store to serve more customers and be able to gain more profit to benefit her family

loans.name: Fasso Djigui Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FASSO DJIGUI ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FASSO DJIGUI sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire. AMI, 1ère femme à droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20Kg d’oignon, 1 paquet de Cube Maggi, 10Litres d‘huile, 10Kg de Sel et 2 boîtes de tomate concentrée. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Fasso Djigui group are all women averaging 33 years of age, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, a neighborhood in San, Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and work buy and selling condiments.

After duly repaying their prior loans, the group members are on their 7th solidarity loan. Ami, the first one from the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 20 kg [44 lbs] of onions, one pack of Maggi bouillon cubes, 10 liters [2.6 gallons] of oil, 10 kg [22 lbs] of salt and two boxes of tomato concentrate. She stocks up with local wholesalers. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit.

She anticipates earning a monthly revenue of 30,000 West African francs, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children. Erlinda manages a fishing business and also owns fish cages. She earns a meager income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of her big family. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for fishing boat engine repair, additional floating guards, and other fishing accessories to improve and expand her fishing business. In the future, Erlinda hopes to arrange a descent house for the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for fishing boat engine repair, additional floating guards, and other fishing accessories.

loans.name: Cheny

texts.en:
Cheny is 31 years old, married,  and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cheny requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cheny has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Juan Octavio

texts.es: Juan es un señor dedicado a impartir clases de educación primaria desde hace 33 años de laborar, en un colegio de la zona donde es originario, del cual se tiene que trasladar a su centro de labores, es soltero con un hijo a su cargo, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento el que utilizaría en la Compra de Zinc, Reglas, Clavos, Cemento, Arena, Ladrillos y Mano de Obra, con los que realizaría mejoras en su cuarto y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a dedicated man who has been teaching primary education classes for 33 years at a school in the area where he is originally from. This means that he has to travel to his job. Juan is single and has one dependent child.

He is currently requesting a loan that will be used for the purchase of zinc sheets, braces, nails, cement, sand, bricks, and labor. He will make improvements to a room, which will provide better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for zinc sheets, braces, nails, cement, sand, bricks, and labor in order to make improvements to a room.

loans.name: Zoila Margarita

texts.es: Zoila de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica desde hace 4 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, también a la elaboración de queso, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez es para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zoila is 34 years old and lives in her own home along with her life companion. She has been making and selling tortillas for four years. Zoila also produces cheese. Her business is located at her place of residence and she has many customers. With the income she earns from her sales, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Zoila is requesting another loan, but this time she will buy corn by the quintal (1 quintal = 100 kg) and lime powder so that she can continue making tortillas. As a result, she will have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is from Pagadian. She and her husband have land with bananas, and earn a living doing farming activities. Arlene recently received a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their land for planting corn, with the hope to yield more harvest. Arlene deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a water buffalo (carabao).

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en: Oeun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Oeun makes a living cultivating rice and doing extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.en:
Paquita is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. Paquita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Paquita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries. In the future, Paquita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Seanyem's Group

texts.en: Seanyem’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.  Seanyem makes a living cultivating rice and doing extra work as a construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thong's Group

texts.en: Thong’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Thong makes a living cultivating rice while doing extra work as a tailor and laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en: Chhin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Chhin makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Seangly's Group

texts.en: Seangly’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Seangly makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: Samnang’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Samnang makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kimang's Group

texts.en: Kimang’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Kimang makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yanivis

texts.es: Yanivis con una sonrisa en sus labios nos cuenta que inició su negocio motivada por una amiga que se dedicaba a la venta de productos por catálogos para la nutrición y la salud; malteadas a base de proteína de soya ideales para mantener una dieta balanceada e infusiones de té y bebidas energizantes, al observar el éxito que su amiga logró, decidió incorporarse y realizó su primer pedido con unos ahorros que tenía, de esta manera Yanivis en el año 2013 se encaminó a la vida como comerciante, hoy en día cuenta con una clientela fidelizada a quienes como estrategia de venta les ofrece facilidad de pago para que incorporen estos productos a su estilo de vida.  Ella es muy comprometida con su negocio por ello labora de lunes a domingo en el horario de 4 p.m. a     9 p.m., agendando a sus clientes para ofrecerles charlas sobre los beneficios del uso de los productos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de productos para tener un stock de productos; Malteada, bebidas energizantes y té de diversas plantas para desintoxicar el organismo. Yanivis tiene metas a futuro como adquirir su casa propia y ampliar la gama y línea de productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
With a smile on her face, Yanivis says that she started her business after she received encouragement from a friend who sells nutritional and health products through catalogs. These items include soy-based protein milkshake powders that are ideal for maintaining a balanced diet, herbal teas, and energy drinks. Yanivis saw how successful her friend was, so she decided to sign up and request her first order with some of her savings. This occurred in 2013 and it started her down the path of becoming a merchant. Today she has loyal customers because she has adopted a sales strategy of offering payment options that help people incorporate these products as part of their lifestyle.

Yanivis is very committed to her business, so she works Monday through Sunday on a regular schedule between 4:00 P.M. and 9 P.M. She conducts seminars for her customers so that she can explain the benefits from using these products. Yanivis is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest the funds in the purchase of products so that she can have them in her inventory. These include milkshake powders, energy drinks, and different herbal teas for detoxing the body. Her future goals are to acquire a house of her home and to expand the range of products that she offers.

loans.use: to buy milkshake powders, energy drinks, and different herbal teas for detoxing the body.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Sae's Group

texts.en: Sae’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Sae makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dania Grissel

texts.es: DANIA   de 21 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante técnico farmacéutica  ya culminando sus estudios con la ayuda de sus padres, Dania ha sabido salir adelante estudiar mucho y poder ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado ella podrá hacer su  titulación. dania  se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada que le está siendo  Kiva  y Edaprospo y se despide con un fuerte abrazo y diciéndoles que cumplirá la promesa de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dania is 21 years old, single, and has no children. She is a good student who is studying to be a pharmacy technician. She is finishing her studies with the help of her parents. Dania has been successful by studying hard.

With this loan granted, she can complete her degree. Dania is very grateful for the help provided by Kiva and Edaprospo. She sends a big hug and tells them that she will fulfill her promise to succeed.

loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Ly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

Vceun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vceun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

loans.name: Zharkynai

texts.ru: Жаркынай, 48 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У Жаркынай среднее образование, с 1988 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, а также 1,0 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает картофель. Жаркынай известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока, скота и картофеля. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаркынай обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку семян картофеля и скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена построить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Zharkynai is 48 years old, married, and she has five children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture since 1998.  This activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  She currently owns three cows and she grows potatoes on one hectare of irrigated land.  Zharkynai is known as a principled, honest, respectable and reliable person.  At the moment, she makes a monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk, livestock and potatoes.  In order to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) which will be used to buy potato seeds as well as additional cattle for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to develop her farming business, and she also wants to build a barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, as well as additional cattle to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Maharramoy

texts.ru: Махаррамой проживает в небольшом городке под названием Турсунзаде. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. В течение 9 лет, Махаррамой занимается бизнесом. Она печет лепешки.  Махаррамой печет вкусные и традиционные лепешки, и она продает лепешки на рынке. Она имеет много клиентов. Ее лепешки хорошо известны и знамениты своими вкусами и запахами. Ей в работе помогает муж. Махаррамой планирует арендовать себе торговую точку на местном рынке за счет заемный средств, и на оставшуюся часть денег она купит дрова, чтобы испечь лепешки. По этой причине Махаррамой обращается за кредитом. Это кредит поможет ей улучшить финансовое положение семьи и расширить деятельность. Махаррамой верит Вас и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Maharramoy lives in the small city of Tursunzoda.  She is 47 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She has been running her own bakery business for the past nine years.  Maharramoy bakes delicious traditional cakes and sells them at the market, where she has many customers.  Her cakes are famous for their delicious taste and wonderful smell.  Her husband helps her to run the business.  

Maharramoy is now planning to borrow money in order to rent a retail outlet at the local market and to buy wood to bake her cakes.  This is the reason why she is taking a loan. This loan will help her to improve the financial situation of her family and to expand her activity.  She relies on you and is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: to rent a retail outlet and to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le h pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, es empleado una venta de granos básicos desde hace algunos años, con lo que obtiene  de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral ya que esta hecho de laminas que es el que muestra en la fotografía, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra y asi el y su familia puedan vivir más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has been employed at a basic provisions store for a few years. With the income he earns from his work, he is able to pay for a few household expenses.

This young man lives in his own home along with his wife and two children. He wants to improve his home by building a security wall since the current one consists of metal sheets, as shown in the photograph. However, he does not earn enough to pay for this project. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to pay for cement, sand, bricks, iron, and labor. As a result, he and his family can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for cement, sand, bricks, iron, and labor in order to build a security wall.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en: Fernanda is 60 years old and married. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past 35 years, Fernanda has been a farmer. She earns 2,000 PHP each month and has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. Fernanda is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Heng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of this group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Zhannat

texts.ru: Жаннат, 26 лет, замужем, детей нет. У Жаннат высшее образование, около года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается торговлей женской одежды. В ведении бизнеса помогает супруг, сама Жаннат также работает кассиром. Товарооборот в магазине составляет 175,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день деятельность Жаннат приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 25,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента в магазине. Доходы от кредита Жаннат планирует использовать для развития своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhannat is 26 years old, married, with no children.  She is a college graduate and she has been selling women's clothes for about a year.  This activity constitutes an additional source of income for her family.  Her husband helps her to run the business, and Zhannat herself works at the cash register.  Her store has a turnover of 175,000 som (KGS).  At the moment, Zhannat makes a monthly income of about 25,000 som (KGS) from her activity.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) which will be used to increase her inventory.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her activity.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale on a retail basis, and also to increase her inventory and attract more customers.

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en: Savoeun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Savoeun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of this group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 56, a widow in Pagadian City, she runs a store that is the primary support for her family. She never tires of tending her store. Cristita is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans in the past. She religiously paid her obligations without record of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having more inventory would mean better income opportunities.In the future. She dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина погасила предыдущий кредит успешно, без нарушений. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Зарины есть дойная корова с теленком, 22 овцы. На участке мерою 1,0 Га собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает люцерну, перец и фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарина обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров с телятами с целью увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Зарина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и в обучение ее детей.
texts.en: Zarina paid off her previous loan without any problem.  She thanks Kiva as well as all the lenders who financed her previous loan.  Zarina currently owns one cow with her calf, and 22 sheep.  She also grows alfalfa, pepper and beans on one hectare of her own land and two hectares of leased land.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  Zarina will use this loan to buy two additional dairy cows with their calves in order to produce and sell larger volumes of organic milk.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her activity and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cow with their calves, in order to produce larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Chham's Group

texts.en: Chham’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chham makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of this group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victorina, de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de jornalero, tienen dos hijos pequeños y viven en casa propia.

Victorina, se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y a engordar cerdos para venderlos y ayudarle a su pareja a pagar los gastos del hogar.


Victorina, solicita el préstamo para comprar lámina para el techo de su casa, ya que actualmente su techo es de teja y cuando llega el invierno, siempre se moja porque el agua traspasa la teja, de esa forma tendrá mayor seguridad.
 
El sueño de Victorina, es reparar por completo su casa, ya que hay muchas partes que tienen daños y eso genera inseguridad para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Victorina is 23 years old and studied through the sixth grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works as a day laborer. They have two young children and live in their own home.

Victorina takes care of the household chores, but she also fattens pigs for sale so that she can help her partner with paying the household expenses. She is requesting a loan in order to buy metal sheets for the roof of her house, which is currently made of tiles. When winter arrives, moisture always seeps through the tiles, so the metal sheets will provide greater security.

Victorina’s dream is to complete the repairs to her house. There are several parts that have sustained damage, which creates insecurity for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets for the roof of her house.

loans.name: Glenda Maricela

texts.es:
Glenda, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos pequeños que están estudiando, junto a ella vive también su abuelo.

Glenda, desde hace quince años, se dedica al negocio de elaborar pan artesanal, aprendió debido a la 
situación económica y a su condición de ser madre soltera; cuando sus hijos llegan de estudiar, le 
ayudar a ir a vender el pan.
 
Glenda, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, con el propósito de tener leche y utilizarla en la elaboración del pan, de esa manera obtendrá mas ingresos económicos y podrá darle todo lo que necesita su familia.

El sueño de Glenda, es mantener su negocio y que sus hijos estudien para que algún día sean profesionales y logren lo que ella no pudo hacer.
texts.en:
Glenda, 32, studied until the second grade, is a single mother, has two small children in school, and lives together with her grandmother. Since she was 15, she has made a living making artisanal bread, which she learned because of her economic situation and her single motherhood; when her children finish school, they help her to go and sell bread.

Glenda needs this loan to buy a cow, with the purpose of having milk to use to make bread, and thus she will obtain better profits and she will be able to give everything she needs to her family. 

Glenda's dream is to maintain her business and for her children to study and to one day become professional and achieve everything she couldn't do.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en: Rithy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rithy makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Palin’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Palin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does work as officer tailor and farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of this group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ol's Group

texts.en: Ol’s group live in a rural village in  Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Ol makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of this group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es: Jose de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijo, el se dedica desde hace 11 años a la siembra de maíz y frijol, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 47 years old. He lives in his own home with his four children. For the past eleven years, Jose has grown corn and beans. He sells his products in the areas around the zone where he lives. With what he earns from his sales he is able to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a new loan to purchase fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides and seeds; and to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph. This way he will be able to continue with his work and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and to improve the land.

loans.name: Ramon Arturo

texts.es: Ramón de 47 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que vive junto a su compañera de vida en vivienda propia desde hace 10 años. Él se gana la vida como jardinero desde hace 10 años prestando sus servicios en residenciales privadas, y gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre solicitan sus servicios. Ramón desea terminar de construir los cuartos de su vivienda ya que por falta de liquidez económica uno de ellos solo cuentan con retazos de tela como única manera de protección, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir los cuartos de su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ramón, age 47, is hardworking man who has been living with his life companion in their own home for the past 10 years. He earns his living as a gardener and has been offering his services to private residences for the past 10 years. Thanks to his experience, Ramón has a large number of clients who are always requesting his services.

Ramón wants to finish building rooms in his home, but due to the lack of financial liquidity, he has resorted to using scraps of fabric as his only means of protection. The loan he is requesting from FUSAI will be invested in the purchase of cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron so that he can finish building the rooms in his home as soon as possible. This will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron so that he can finish building the rooms in his home.

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo  De Crédito San Agustín Km 20.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores  de edad e independientes. El marido se dedica a la agricultura. 
Ella es una gran esposa y ama de casa que para ganar algo por su cuenta y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella tienen un negocio de venta de repuestos de Bicicletas y también tiene de un depósito de gas de uso domestico, ella siempre se ocupo de su negocio pero ahora le ayuda su marido y un hijo ya que ella está un poco enferma y no puede atender su negocio, son más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le ha dado lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar llantas y repuestos para bicicletas. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños que su salud mejore.
texts.en:
The city Bahía De Caraquez is known for its beautiful beaches, its rich and varied cuisines, and the warmth of its people. The members of the Communal Bank named “San Agustín Km. 20” meet in this city every 15 days.

Sra. María lives in this place. She is 54 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three grown children who are independent. Her husband works in agriculture.

María is a good wife and homemaker who earns her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She works in retail. María has a business of selling bicycle parts, but she also has a warehouse where she sells gas for household use. She has always been busy managing her business, but now her husband and son are helping her since she has been a bit unwell and is not able to run the business. María has worked at her business for 10 years and it has given her what she needs to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy tires and bicycle parts. María is a founding member of her Communal Bank and she enjoys the help that the loans have provided. Her dreams include being in better health.

loans.use: to buy tires and bicycle parts.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina agradece su primer crédito con el cual logro comprar los fertilizantes necesarios que fueron aplicados en sus cultivos de café, dando al cuidado a la planta y el grano en su totalidad. Además ella logro pagar mano de obra calificada con la cual asistió la plantación limpiando de maleza la propiedad. Gracias a ello su producción de café fue un éxito logrando vender el grano a muy buen precio en el mercado y entre los intermediarios de la zona con lo cual percibió ingresos que fueron utilizados para pagar el crédito con la institución entre otros compromisos que anteriormente no podía cancelar. Actualmente Agustina solicita ser apoyada con un segundo crédito para nuevamente elaborar la compra de insumos que serán aplicados a sus cultivos de café y con cada temporada ir mejorando la calidad del producto y aumentando la plantación lo cual por ende mejorando los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina is grateful for her first loan, which she used to purchase the fertilizers which needed to be applied to her coffee crop. This enabled her to care for the plant and the fruit in its entirety. Additionally, she was able to pay skilled laborers who helped her clear the whole plantation of weeds. Thanks to this, her coffee production was a success and she was able to sell the beans at a very good price in the market and to intermediaries in the area. Through the sales she accrued income which was used to pay off the loan and other debts which she had not been able to pay before.

Agustina requests the support of a second loan, again to purchase supplies which will be applied to her coffee plants. Each season she will improve the quality of her product and grow the plantation. In the end, this will improve her income for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: Crispina makes good earnings on her farming activities in Aloran. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially since she has a high cost of living when her children entered college. Crispina approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Ederson Rolando

texts.es: Ederson un joven de 20 años de edad es soltero. Actualmente cursa el 2do año de la carrera técnica de Refrigeración por el periodo de 03 años de estudio. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera pues siempre pensó en emprender su propio negocio y por ser de mayor demanda. Actualmente se encuentra realizando sus prácticas profesionales en una empresa de refrigeración. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo moral y económico que siempre le brindaron. Ser un profesional competitivo y eficiente es su mayor deseo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de materiales y pago de su pensión de estudio. Ederson agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a jóvenes como el que buscan  superarse profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Ederson is 20 years old and single. He is currently studying his second year of a technical course in refrigeration. His course lasts three years in total. Ederson decided to study this subject as he has always wanted to own his own business and because this is an area of business that is in high demand. Ederson is currently doing an internship at a refrigeration business.

Ederson is grateful to his parents for the moral and financial support that they have always given him. Ederson’s greatest wish is to become a competitive and efficient professional. He is applying for this loan in order to buy materials and pay for his studies. Ederson is grateful to Kiva investors for supporting young people like him who want to move forward in their professional lives.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more wholesale natural medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 7 años al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y hortalizas, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes fijos, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder tener un buen cultivo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman – whose face is pixelated because she is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk area – has been growing corn, beans and vegetables for seven years. She sells her products in neighbouring towns and has regular customers. The borrower is a single mother and lives in her privately owned house with her two children. She is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-pest treatments, and weed-killers, and to improve her land (shown in the photo) so that she may have good crops and a higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-pest treatments, and weed-killers, and to improve her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy avocados, tomatoes, green beans, and chayote for sale.

loans.name: Grupo Xepec Group

texts.es:
Lirica es una señorita de 20 años, ella es soltera vive en un lugar llamado Santa Lucia Utatlán, ella es muy extrovertida y sus papas están orgulloso de ella. 

Lirica Felipa (primera de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía) es una señorita que trabaja muy fuerte,  con el fin de buscar  superación en la vida y por su dedicación  a la  actividad ha sido ejemplar para otras personas, pues ella para la generación de su economía se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes en el mercado de su comunidad, pues ella vende únicamente una vez a la semana, cuando es día de plaza, esto es porque ella no cuenta con un local formal,  pues ella únicamente utiliza piso plaza. Pues ella se siente feliz con este trabajo porque le genera sus ingresos y le deja también ganancias. 
Pues Lirica en los días libres  también trabaja para una guardería en su misma comunidad y con   esta segunda actividad; logro hacer más cosas en la vida, Lirica quiere agrandar su venta, pues para lograr ella solicita un prestamo que le servirá para comprar más abarrotes y ofrecer diversidad de productos a su clientela. 
El sueño de Lirica es que en un futuro, pueda conseguir un espacio donde construir su propio local, pues Lirica  no solo busca superación para ella,  lo que ella anhela es la superación para otras persona  y este vez  ha   integrado  a dos mujeres más para que ellas logren también sus planes o proyectos.
texts.en:
Lirica is 20 years old, single and lives in Santa Lucia Utatlán. She is very extroverted, and her parents are very proud of her.

Lirica (first on the right in the photograph) is a young woman who works very hard in order to do better in life. Showing dedication at her work, she is a role model for other as she earns an income buying and selling groceries at the local market. Lirica only sells her products once a week as she has no formal premises and can only use certain spaces to sell her products. Lirica is happy with this work as it allows her to earn an income and gives her a profit too.

In her spare time, Lirica also works for a local nursery. This second job allows her to achieve more in life. 

Lirica wants to increase her sales. In order to do this she is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy more groceries and offer a variety of products to her customers.

Lirica’s dream is to be able to buy land where she can build her own premises for her business. Lirica does not just want to get ahead herself but to help others. She currently has two other women who help her with her business plans.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro de 62 años de edad es viudo vive en casa propia con su hijo quien estudia actualmente, el se dedica desde hace 40 años a la siembra de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego venderlos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Pedro está  solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. par seguir con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 62 year old widow who lives in his own house with his son who currently goes to school.  He has been working for the last 40 years growing corn and beans.  When the harvest is ready he stores the products in the barn and shows the picture to different agencies who buy and sell basic grains.  He already has established clients and with the sales he's able to pay for some of the home expenses.  
Pedro is requesting a loan to buy materials for seed planting, fertilizers, herbicides, and plague control chemicals to continue growing his crops and thus have better income.

loans.use: buy materials for seed planting, fertilizers, herbicides, and plague control chemicals.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es: Virgilio de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y ya  tiene muchos clientes, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 2 daughters.  He has been growing corn and beans for a few years.  He sells his products in the nearby areas where he lives and already has many clients.
He's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and plague control chemicals to improve his plot of land, as shown in the picture, to continue growing his crops and have a better income.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, and plague control chemicals to improve his plot of land.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.es:
Lurdes es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Central donde se encuentran  comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de acomodar esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 20-28 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Lurdes es de tez morena, cabello negro largo baja estatura, habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con el esposo que se dedica  a la actividad de construcción y su hijo pequeño, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; pantalones, cinturones, polera manga corta, bermudas, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día en un puesto de venta en la calle al aire libre. “cuando llueve es que me perjudica ya que tengo te tapar mi mercadería para que no se moje ” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lurdes solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
.
texts.en:
Lurdes is a 26 year old woman. She is single and has one 2 year old son. Her business is selling second hand clothing. She is a good mother who is enterprising, has a good attitude, and is responsible and hardworking. She does her business in the central area where there are wholesale distributors who take care of getting the products to the different markets in the city. It has a warm climate with temperature that varies between 20-28 degrees Celsius during the whole year. 

Lurdes has dark skin, black hair, and short stature. She speaks Spanish for the general culture and for business. She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and their young son. They live in a rented house made of brick. It has electricity, potable water and plumbing. Her business is selling second hand clothing, such as pants, belts, short sleeve shirts, bermuda shorts, and more. She does this work every day of the week in an open air sales locale on the street. “When it rains, it affects me because I have to cover my merchandise so it doesn't get wet," she says. Her dream is to have a store. She wants to buy second hand clothing wholesale to stock up for her customers for the seasonal demand. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that she has been doing this activity. 

That is why Lurdes is asking for a loan to buy second hand clothing wholesale to stock up for her customers for the season.  
.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, cement, blocks, sand, and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to expand a room in her house.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more coconuts to sell to customers.

Letecia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Letecia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, re-bar, grills and pay for labor.

loans.name: Thouch

texts.en:
Thouch, 45 years old, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She is married to Ban, 47, and this couple has three children. To make a living, the couple has been involved in fishery since 2010 and earns, on average, an income of USD 8 a day. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is a resident of Coron Palawan, Philippines. She is 36 years old and she is married to Jameson. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to improve their present financial status and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Rochelle owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg for example. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price. Then she sells per piece for a higher price to have a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 1,000 each day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Rochelle desires to expand and grow her business and she is hoping to give her family a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry, 36, is a married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cherry has a electronic load retailer business in the Philippines. Cherry has been in this business for two years.

Cherry requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy loads for her electronic business.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy loads for her electronic load business.

loans.name: Ma. Divinia

texts.en:
Ma. Divinia is 50 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 21 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Ma Divinia requested her seventh loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, coffee, groceries, etc. Ma. Divinia hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, coffee, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling processed food.  

Emily is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is 58 years old and married with four children. Evelia works very hard to provide for them.

Evelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Evelia has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, coffee, toothpaste, salt, noodles, ginger, onions, etc. 

In the future, Evelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 38 years old and married with seven children. With seven children in school, Gilda works very hard to provide for them.

Gilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, eggs, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Gilda has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, laundry soap, soft drinks, slippers, canned goods, noodles, junk foods, etc. 

In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, eggs, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Lina is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her buy and sell coconut wine business.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 46 years now.

Lourdes has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana started her small business and became a boss with her sari-sari (general) store. She has managed to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay. 

Recently she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock store inventories. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store inventories.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
In 2013, Damiana learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the various programs and services it offers. Since then she has focused her farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Damiana borrowed another amount to pay for fertilizers and herbicides. This will help her to gain more farming income. Damiana looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Resurecion

texts.en:
Resurecion is 55 years old and married with twelve children. With three children in school, Resurecion works very hard to provide for them.

Resurecion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6.000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as coffee, condiments, groceries, etc.

Resurecion has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soap, coffee, biscuits, soy sauce, beverages, candies, etc.

In the future, Resurecion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as coffee, condiments, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 56 years old and married with eight children. With three of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as candies, eggs, groceries, etc.

Ruth has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, junk foods, salt, candies, dried fish, etc.

In the future, Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as candies, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gladis Ondina

texts.es: Gladis agradece el crédito brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL a través de los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA ya que gracias a ello pudo aplicar los fertilizantes a su propiedad en el año 2013 al igual que a su vivero logrando obtener una buena cosecha sobre la misma y cancelando su crédito antes del tiempo estipulado. También gracias al financiamiento brindado logro mejorar la cosecha y mantener sana la plantación cubriendo con esto algunos compromisos que anteriormente no podía. Gladis regresa con la frente en alto a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para volver a solicitar una vez más apoyo económico con el cual pueda asistir su propiedad de café en esta nueva temporada comprando nuevamente los insumos agrícolas necesarios para evitar que la plantación sea dañada o afectada por factor clima o alguna plaga por lo cual espera ser apoyada en esta nueva ocasión ya que los ingresos para el hogar dependen de la temporada de café de forma fuerte y salir adelante con cada una.
texts.en:
Gladis is grateful for the loan given her by the COMIXMUL cooperative through the various lenders at KIva as thanks to that she can apply fertilizers to her property in 2013 as well as her greenhouse. She was able to collect a good harvest from them and pay off her loan ahead of the stipulated time. Thanks again to the loan she managed to improve her harvest and keep her plantation healthy being able to pay some compromises that she could not do before.

Gladis is returning to the COMIXMUL cooperative with her head held high to once more request financial assistance so she can care for her coffee crops in this new season buying once again the agricultural inputs needed to avoid having her plantation damaged or affected by the climate or an infestation. So she hopes to be supported on this new occasion as the household income depends very strongly on the coffee season and she hopes to progress with each harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, foliar sprays and other fertilizers to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Geraldine Milagros

texts.es:
Geraldine es una joven estudiante de la Carrera de Administración Industrial de SENATI. Ella vive actualmente con sus padres y sus 3 hermanos. Su madre es empleada del hogar, se dedica a las labores domésticas. Su padre es agricultor, dedicándose al trabajo de campo de manera muy eventual. 
Actualmente ella se encuentra cursando el 2° Semestre de su carrera, pero debido a que su padre fue despedido de su trabajo y el ingreso de la madre era mínimo, recurren al apoyo de KIVA para poder continuar con sus estudios y llegar a ser una profesional exitosa. La carrera que Geraldine tiene gran demanda.
De no haber tenido opción para el crédito, le hubiera impedido continuar con sus estudios, debido a que su familia está pasando por una difícil situación económica que no le permite continuar solventando sus estudios y ello truncaría sus sueños profesionales.
Ella piensa retribuir en un futuro todo lo que sus padres y KIVA hacen para apoyarla en el sueño de culminar sus estudios, se siente muy feliz y tranquila con KIVA porque desde ya siente el gran apoyo que le están brindando, agradeciéndoles todo lo que hacen por ella.
texts.en:
Geraldine is a student of Industrial Administration at SENATI. She lives with her parents and 3 siblings. Her mother is a domestic worker and her father works in agriculture. She is currently in her second year of studies, but because her father lost his job, and her mother does not earn a lot, she has come to Kiva for help so she can continue her studies and have a professional career one day. The career that Geraldine is studying for is currently in high demand.

If it were not for the loan with Kiva, she would have to quit school because of her family's current difficult financial situation.

Geraldine dreams of a better future thanks to all that her parents and Kiva have done for her. She is very happy and content with Kiva because of the help she is receiving and the support they give her. She is thankful for everything that everyone has done for her.

loans.use: pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú tiene 36 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos una niña de 9 años de edad y dos varones de 17 y 8 años de edad. Desde hace 5 años Marilú se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos lo que le ha permitido darle todo lo mejor que está en sus manos a su familia, ya que ella siempre busca que tengan las mejores condiciones de vida. La vivienda de Marilú es bastante pequeña por lo que ella siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia ha decidido ampliarla y de esta manera brindarle una mayor comodidad a su familia, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marilú is 36 years old. She owns a house where she lives with her husband and three children: a 9-year-old daughter and two sons aged 17 and 8. Marilú has worked for five years as a housekeeper. This has helped her to give her family the best she can; she is always fighting to give them the best living conditions.

Marilú lives in a small house. Since she is always thinking of what is best for her family, she decided to enlarge it in order to give them a more comfortable home.

This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron bars to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron bars to enlarge her house.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
LIM, 63, lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has five children in total, two are single and three are married. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and vegetable and sells her agriculture product to the local dealers. She has been involved in this business for thirty five years. She is able to make an income of USD 5.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be repaired to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a KIVA loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 41 years old, married and she has children who are still attending school. Her spouse is a farmer, while she generates income by selling snacks and vegetables. She wants to increase her sales so she is asking for additional capital of P5,000 to buy vegetables, hot dogs, sausages and cured pork to sell. She hopes to increase foods she sells to improve her profits for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, hot dogs, sausages and cured pork to sell

loans.name: Maolinda

texts.en:
This is Maolinda, 52, resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Edgar and they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Maolinda is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Maolinda operates a food stall. In the Philippines the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend money on cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an Php 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Maolinda hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 23 years old, married, and had two young children. She is selling vegetables to earn income. She wants to increase her profits and need additional capital to buy more vegetables to sell. She is now asking for P4,000 to buy squash, eggplant and tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to keep improving her sales and earn good income for her family.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Ma. Morena

texts.en:
From Coron Palawan, Ma. Morena has been an active member of CCT for years and she was able to acquire several loans to help her make a good profit from her business. She is 24 and is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs. She was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day and she is pretty sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Ma. Morena owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone to making this happen. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, toothpaste or even an ice cube. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she will sell them at a higher price to have a profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday so she is requesting an Php 11,000 loan which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future and and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Ma. Morena meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to display in her store.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salvacion is 51 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Salvacion has an eatery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Salvacion has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 35 years old and married with two children. With both of her children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as shampoo, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Susan has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as beverages, soap, milk, coffee, candies, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as shampoo, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 47-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonila has a motorcycle passenger business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle.

Leonila has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional wheels and other spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is 54 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Erminda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Erminda requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Erminda has been farming rice for two years and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and married with eight children. With three children in school, Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, canned goods, coffee, groceries, etc..

Anita has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, canned goods, coffee, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina is 59 years old and a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Esterlina has a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines. Esterlina requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional wheels for her bicycle taxi.

Esterlina has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Esterlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional wheels for her bicycle taxi

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Sylvia has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Flaviana is 43 years old, and all four of her children are in school.

Flaviana has a seaweed business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her seaweed business.

Flaviana has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Calexta

texts.en:
Calexta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old now.

Calexta has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Calexta has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María, de 54 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado académico, está viuda desde hace 8 años, su esposo fue albañil y él mismo construyo la casa, tiene 4 hijos y todos tienen sus propios hogares.

María, tiene 6 años de experiencia en la venta de pupusas, una sobrina la motivo a que se dedicará a este negocio, ya que ella también vende pupusas en la capital y le dijo a María, que este negocio dejaba buenas ganancias.- Antes, se dedicaba solo a los oficios domésticos, para ir a comprar los insumos que necesita para elaborar sus productos, viaja en bus o en carro. 

María, necesita el crédito para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas, de esa manera logrará mejor su calidad de vida.

El sueño de María, es que su negocio crezca y tener clientes fieles, que siempre le compren.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and has no formal education. She has been a widow for 8 years. Her husband was a bricklayer and he built their house himself. She has 4 children who all have their own homes.

María has 6 years experience selling pupusas. A niece motivated her to work in this business as she also sells pupusas in the capital. She told María that this business makes good profit. Before she used to do domestic work. To go and buy her supplies she needs to make her product she travels by bus or car.



María needs the loan to buy a grill to make pupusas. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of living. María's dream is for her business to grow and have loyal clients who always buy from her.

loans.use: to buy a new grill to make pupusas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida Rosa, es una mujer trabajadora que ahora se siente más empoderada de sí misma y con la certeza de que su vida seguirá prosperando. Poco a poco ha venido viendo el crecimiento de su pulpería, ya que ha logrado incrementar su inventario con diversos productos y de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Cándida Rosa para mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita un crédito para construir el servicio higiénico de su casa, y así, habitar en condiciones más saludables tanto ella como su familia y vivir mejor. Los planes de Candida son cancelar este crédito para luego seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa is a hard working woman who has always felt empowered and has held the certainty that she would be prosperous in life. Little by little she has seen her grocery store business grow and she has been able to expand her inventory and to meet customer demand.

She is applying for a loan today in order to construct a bathroom in her home and to have healthier conditions for her family and to simply live better. Her plan is to pay off this personal loan and then being investing in her business again.

loans.use: construct a bathroom for her house.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат 42 года, вдова, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, работает почтальоном. Гулзат в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2008 году с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Гулзат на сегодняшний день имеет корову и 6 овец. На участке мерою 0,9 Га арендованной и 0,6 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации.
