loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cases of beverages for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement and sand to improve the walls of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a bright woman. She is from the southern part of the country. She lives in a small town with her parents. She is single; she is a student. She studies Philology. She is a senior, and it is her last year of her studying. She had a dream to be a teacher from childhood. She has grown up in family of workers, and graduated with excellence her school. She studied well in order to enter to the university. Her dream became true, and she entered the university. 

Now she needs to pay tuition for the university. She is asking for financial support to pay tuition of education.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase string beans, squash, and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Christina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for 22 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been farming vegetables for 35 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a married woman with six children; three of her children are studying in university. One of her children is Moayad who is 21 years old, studying political science. In spite of facing hard conditions like the weak economic situation of the family, Sameera and her son  did not give up. Her son studied very hard and passed with very good grades to realize his mother's dream which is for him to enter the university and continue his studies.

The family`s income can't cover the family expenditures in addition to the university fees for Moayad and his siblings, So Moayad decided to work and study at the same time.

Although Moayad is working, he could not cover the university fees because of the increasing cost of living. Therefore Sameera applied for an education loan to pay for her son`s university fees, to help him graduate and find a better job to help his family with household expenses.

loans.use: To pay for her son`s university fees

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Virgenia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Virgenia has been farming vegetables for 20 years, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elena has been farming vegetables for 30 years, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gretchel

texts.en:
Gretchel is 21 years old with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

Gretchel has been in this business for one year now.  In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Seangly's Group

texts.en: Seangly’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Seangly makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Seangly's Group is asking for a loan to buy a water filter. Having a water filter at home will help each of the three women of the Group to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Ana Elia es caficultora desde hace 55 años, ella tiene 75 años y vive con cuatro nietos. Ana está en el proceso de conversión de café convencional a café orgánico ella ha avanzado con recursos propios en este proceso, pero quiere fortalecerlo con la compra de 2 vacas con las cuales obtendrá la materia prima para producir los abonos orgánicos sólidos, también necesita comprar una despulpadora, con esta inversión Ana mejorara la calidad y aumentara la producción del  café, para logra esto ella necesita 5.000.000 de pesos. 
Sus metas a mediano y largo plazo es aumentar su producción en 3.000 kgs de café pergamino seco y sembrar 6.800 árboles de café, a nivel familiar Ana desea mejorar su vivienda y ayudar a sus nietos para que continúen estudiando en temas relacionados con la caficultura.

La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Ana ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La Federación Campesina del Cauca está convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Elia has been a coffee grower for 55 years. She is 75 years old and lives with four grandchildren. Ana is in the process of converting her coffee crops from conventional to organic. She has so far paid for the conversion with her own funds, but would like to enhance the process by purchasing two cows, which would produce the raw material for solid organic fertilizer, as well as a pulper. This investment will enable Ana to improve coffee quality and production, and will require 5,000,000 pesos. Her medium- and long-term goals are to increase her production to 3000 kg of dried parchment coffee and to plant 6800 coffee plants. 

In terms of family, Ana would like to make improvements to her house and help her grandchildren so that they may continue to study subjects related to coffee production. The conversion of production of organic coffee is a comprehensive, independent, wholesome, balanced, and environmentally-friendly long-term process. It poses a challenge for Colombia's farmers. Ana has decided not to risk her health, nor that of her family or consumers, by continuing to use chemicals. The Peasant Farmer Federation of El Cauca is convinced about the merits of supporting these alternative efforts. A loan from Kiva symbolizes a sustainable future for their crops, their land, and their families.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and a pulper.

loans.name: Chhuneng's Group

texts.en: The members of Chhuneng’s Group live in a rural village in Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Chhuneng makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Chhuneng's Group is asking for a loan to buy a water filter. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of our new agents, Yasin. Yasin lives in Sukabumi, West Java, located about two hours drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife. Yasin owns a small stall where he sells snacks and drinks, daily consumer products, and mobile phone airtime. His wife is a full time wife. He just joined Ruma two weeks ago. He was introduced to Ruma's product by one of our sales executives, and since that day he was really interested to join Ruma. He wants to learn about how to improve his small business as well.

Since he joined Ruma, Yasin is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Yasin improve his business and accordingly, his community, who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Yasin is the one who is standing in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
La’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. 

La makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and housemaker to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and cement blocks, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1978. She is living in a village. She is married; she has five children. Her husband is a builder. She has 10 years of experience working with animals. She is an agricultural person. She likes to work and keeps livestock. She has three big honored cattle and four small cattle. She feeds livestock and sells them in the domestic market. She is satisfied of her business. It gives enough profit for feeding a family. 

Nargiza is planning to enlarge her business. She wants to buy additional honored cattle. She has requested financial support for buying honored cattle.

loans.use: To buy additional honored cattle

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is married. He has two daughters. Vitaliy has his own business.

Vitaliy has been selling clothes at the market for 15 years. The most popular products are bathrobes, pajamas, and underwear. Vitaliy is an open and  very hardworking person. His goal is to develop his business further. 

Vitaliy is asking for a loan of 30,000 UAH to increase the assortment of women's and men's clothes. The loan will help him to get new clients.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of clothes to attract new clients

loans.name: Marian Joy

texts.en:
Marian Joy is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Pasay City, Philippines. She is 26 years old, and she manages a vegetable stand business and their income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures. 

Marian Joy buys fresh vegetables like eggplant, bitter gourd, ginger and many others. She also sells squash, citrus fruits and other Filipino fruit staples for sometime. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day. 

Marian Joy is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan to purchase more varieties of vegetables to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales, and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

Aside from becoming successful in business and future plans, Marian Joy also desires to establish her own family someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetable items

loans.name: Abdou-Sanedou Atcha

texts.fr: Abdou- Samedou est un jeune homme de 28ans qui a une famille en charge(une femme commerçante et 02 enfants de 4 et 02ans). Il a appris la couture et ouvert son atelier depuis 2011. Il demande un premier crédit pour acheter de la machine à broderie pour satisfaire les demandes des clients. Il souhaite à l'avenir devenir un brodeur de renom et avoir de l'argent pour la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en: Abdou- Samedou is a young man, 28 years old, who  has a family to support (a merchant wife and two children, aged 4 and 2). He learned how to sew and opened his workshop in 2011. He is asking for an initial loan to purchase an embroidering machine in order to satisfy the demands of his customers. For the future, he would like to become a famous embroiderer and to have the money to provide schooling for his children.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidering machine

loans.name: Darlen

texts.en:
Darlen is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Darlen has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to offer for sale.

Darlen has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 44 years old and has seven children. She is married and has seven children who are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 66 years old and a married woman with five children. Four of her children are in school; she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Editha has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Editha has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is fifty-four years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Edna has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Edna would like to save enough money in order to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jermilin

texts.en:
Jermilin is 41 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Jermilin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Jermilin has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Jermilin aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries

loans.name: Rasmeya

texts.en:
Rasmeya does not work, and her husband works as a driver. She is a conservative woman, and asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. She is blessed with three children. 

Even though two members of her family are earning income, it is sometimes insufficient to meet all the needs of their children. 

That is why, to send her daughter to college, Rasmeya wants to borrow an education loan to pay for her daughter's tuition fees. 

Her daughter Rahmah is studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration degree because she dreams of becoming a successful certified public accountant.

Rasmeya needs your help to see her daughter graduated one day.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell, dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional coconut meat to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for eight years now and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, 53 years old, lives in Baqaa. She is mother of two children, She is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the photo. 

Halima had been facing difficulties in her life. Her husband died when her sons were still children. She worked hard to live. She has carried early responsibility and she never complained, but she has challenged all the difficulties which have worked to obstruct her life. 

Now, her son, 22 years old, is studying management information systems. Halima wants to see him graduate and find good work. Perhaps he will remove some of the responsibility that she carried all these years. 

Halima is not stopping the help she gives her sons. She applied for a loan to pay the university fees for her son.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for her son.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham district, Pheap is 65 years old and married. She earns a living by farming rice, and working as a paid worker to supplement the family’s income. The current business earns her about 55,000 KHR per day.

Pheap is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is thirty-seven years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Adela has been in this business for eight years. 

In the future Adela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Acram

texts.en:
Acram is a 29-year-old single man who lives with his family in Haja city, Yemen. He is a an educated man and a student in the University. Due to the very miserable condition of his family, Acram doesn't have a phone to contact other people. These days a mobile phone is very important for any person to make relations with others. Acram doesn't have money to purchase. 

As a result, he applied for a loan of 74,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a mobile phone for him.

Acram hopes to get of a suitable job after his graduation from the University.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone

loans.name: Byonna Biva Gyoli Group

texts.en:
Henry is a 38-year-old married man with five children and a resident of Buwanuka Kakiri in Wakiso district. He and fellow members are repeat customers who pay well. He has been running a loan of UGX 400,000 which he has paid off and is now applying for loan of UGX 500,000. The purpose of the loan is to pay fees for his children since they are reporting for their first term this week.

He is a farmer and also does bricklaying. He is a very hardworking man and also loves his work. His future plan is to borrow more money and start up a farm in his home area. He is a very honest and aggressive young man who loves working and is also committed to his job. He greatly appreciates the efforts of the funders, especially for the financial support given to him.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es una mujer de San Pablo Jocopilas, casada de 35 años, ella tiene 3 hijos, los tres estudian en la escuelita de la comunidad donde viven. 
Marcelina es una mujer muy dedica al trabajo,  su interés es apoyar a su esposo para la generación de  ingresos económicos, pues la actividad que realiza Marcelina es la venta de materiales de construcción, con ese negocio ella lleva 6 años,  pues la idea de Marcelina es agrandar el negocio, pero el obstáculo es que ella no cuenta con suficiente capital de trabajo, entonces la solución que ha encontrado Marcelina es conseguir un prestamo de diez mil quetzales para poder comprar más materiales y equipar mejor el negocio  y primera mente Dios con las ganancias que genera, ella estaría pagando el prestamo.
Marcelina a parte del negocio ella también cuenta con una piscina y una cancha sintética,  en la comunidad donde vive, son dos actividades más que le generan más ingresos. Pues el anhelo  de Marcelina  es incrementar sus ingresos  y sus ganancias, para que sus hijos puedan tener todo lo necesario y vivir en armonía. Marcelina tiene esperanzas de conseguir el prestamo.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 35 years old and has three children. All three go to school in the community where they live.

Marcelina is a hard working woman who wants to help her husband with family expenses. She earns a living selling construction materials and has been running her business for six years. Marcelina wants to expand her business, but she doesn't have enough investment capital. And so, she has come to Kiva to ask for a loan that she will use to purchase more materials and to better supply her store. With the earnings she generates, she will be able to pay back her loan.

Marcelina also has a pool and a synthetic field in her community, which are other locations that generate money for her. Marcelina's dream is to increase her earnings so her children have all they need and can have peaceful lives. She very much hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Melba has been engaged in cooking and selling grilled chicken in her community for years now. She is 49 years of age and blessed with a child. Her husband, Gerson, is an architect, and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food.

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of the amount of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional raw products such as chicken and seasonings that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Melba dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw foodstuffs, such as chicken and seasonings, she needs to improve her business.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
This is Quirina. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Quirina hopes that her business will continue to become successful. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for household and personal products to sell.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is 34 years old and married with five children. He is working in car rental, which is very well-known in the area. He could not complete his study because of his family financial problems, but he realized that the certificate is the only weapon in life. Adnan will begin his education at the university. He aspires to continue his education and access a field of work that will be suitable for him. He asked for an education loan to pay for his tuition, and will use this loan to pay for study materials and assessments as required by his profession.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition, and  to pay for study materials and assessments as required by his profession

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Marilou aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mary Lou is 60 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Mary Lou is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Mary Lou has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Lou would like to save enough money in order to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: María Angela

texts.es:
María, de 54 años de edad, está casada, tiene cuatro hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad y emigraron a los estados unidos hace ya muchos años, ella vive sola en su casa de habitación con su esposo, que trabaja haciendo viajes todos los días de la semana, en la comunidad donde reside.

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, ya que tiene que cuidar la casa donde viven, mientras su esposo realiza los viajes. En ocasiones, cuando hay temporadas donde la demanda es buena, ella vende ropa.

Ella, necesita el crédito para pagar la reparación del vehículo de su esposo, pues se le daño y ese es su medio de transporte y su herramienta de trabajo; necesita apoyar a su esposo para que vuelva a trabajar con el carro, haciendo viajes en diferentes partes de la comunidad. 

El sueño de María, es comprar un vehículo en mejor estado, que no les genere muchos inconvenientes, y así poder obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years of age, and married with four children. They are all adults and it's been several years since they emigrated to the United States. She lives at home with her husband who works making trips every day of the week in the community in which they reside. Maria finds work as a domestic house attendant, since she already has to look after her own house, meanwhile her husband makes the trips. 

On occasion, during the season when the demand is good, she sells clothes. She needs a loan to repair her husband's vehicle as it has been damaged and it's his means of transport and livelihood; she needs to support her husband so he can return to work with his car, marking trips to different parts of the community. Maria's dream is to purchase a vehicle in better condition, that doesn't generate so many inconveniences, and this way they can obtain better income.

loans.use: To pay for the repair of her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more water for resale

loans.name: Ana Gricelda

texts.es: Ana de 71 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su pequeña venta de ropa actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años de manera ambulante. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijas mayores de edad que le apoyan económicamente, además vive con ellos su nieto de 3 años de edad. Ana desea comprar más mercadería ya que en época navideña las ventas son mejores por lo que ella desea contar con una buena cantidad de ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esa manera obtener mejores ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, camisetas, leggins, etc.
texts.en: Ana is 71 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who works harder every day to provide for her family through her clothing sales. Ana has been a street vendor for 10 years. She lives with her partner and their three adult daughters, who support her economically. She also lives with a three-year-old gradchild. Ana would like to buy more merchandise, as sales are best during the the Christmas season. She would like to have a large quantity of clothes to offer her clients and thus improve her income, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, leggins, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, leggins, etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años, y una hija de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de verduras por mayor.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, constante, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y por su feria los días jueves y domingo; dónde se puede encontrar desde un alfiler hasta un tractor.
Valentina es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla con su familia y algunos comerciantes, habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al negocio y sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable, alcantarillado y gas natural. Su negocio es la venta de verduras por mayor, tomate, lechugas, habas, arvejas, zanahorias y verduras de temporada. “las verduras están de moda para la salud y para no engordar…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un galpón donde almacenar mas cantidad. Ella desea realizar la compra de verduras por mayor para abastecer la demanda de temporada y satisfacer a sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Valentina solicita un préstamo para la compra de verduras por mayor para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Valentina is a 45-year-old married woman. She has two sons aged 14 and 11, and an 8-year-old daughter. Valentina earns a living selling vegetables in bulk. She is entrepreneurial, a good mother, persistent, independent, responsible, and hard-working. Valentina works in the '16 de julio' area, a place characterized by commercial activity and its Thursday and Sunday markets. A place where it is possible to find anything from a pin to a tractor. Valentina is dark-skinned, short, and has braided black hair. She wears traditional clothing (hat, wrap, and traditional Andean skirt). Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks with her family and some merchants. She speaks Spanish to communicate with others and for her business. Valentina lives with her husband, who also works in the business, and her children, who are enrolled in school. They live in their own house, which was build from adobe bricks and has electricity, running water, sewer lines, and natural gas. Valentina sells vegetables in bulk: tomatoes, lettuce, beans, peas, carrots, and seasonal vegetables. "Vegetables are fashionable now, as they're healthy and not fattening..." she says. Her dream is to have a shed where she can store a larger quantity. She would like to buy vegetables in bulk to meet the season's demand and satisfy her customers. This is the second loan through this organization in 10 years of being in business. Valentina is requesting a loan to buy vegetables in bulk in order to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk in order to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Irayanti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for us to introduce you to one of our Ruma agents, Irayanti. Irayanti lives in West Bogor, West Java. She lives there with her husband and her daughter. She owns a stall where she sells mobile airtime credits. Irayanti’s husband works in mobile phone sales. To help her husband improve their life, she decided to join Ruma four months ago. She feels happy because ever since she joined Ruma, she can improve her business and save more money for another business opportunity. She feels that the Ruma sales executive is really helpful and informative as well.

Although she just joined Ruma for four months, her track record in selling mobile airtime credits has been quite impressive. As the business runs, Irayanti needs to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Irayanti improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Irayanti is the one who is standing in her own stall. She will be very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 28-year-old single man and a resident of Makerere, a city suburb. He is an old client of our institution and a very good payer. He has been running a loan of UGX 500,000 for four months and he has now applied for the loan of UGX 1,000,000. He is a motorcycle taxi (boda boda) driver and the purpose of the loan is to buy another motorcycle so as to increase his income.

His future plan is to borrow more money and start up a farm in his home area. He is a very honest and aggressive young man who loves working and is also committed to his job. He greatly appreciates the efforts of the funders, especially for support given to him as a young man trying to make ends meet.

loans.use: To top up on payment for a new motorcycle

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Augusta is 54 years old and is married with 5 children, 3 of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for all of them.

Augusta runs a general store in the Philippines, a business she has been in for 15 years.

Augusta has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, spices, noodles, sugar, eggs, etc.

Augusta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, spices, noodles, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is an aggressive woman who is an agriculturalist and also trades in hides and animal skins. She is a 48-year-old widow who strives to make ends meet.

For the past 24 years, Sarah's focus has been on what she knew best, which is agriculture and livestock. Because her husband sold hides, she took over the business after his demise. She now buys hides from the butchers, processes them, and sells them to the factory. 

Sarah will use the loan to buy more animal skins to increase her income, so that she can take her children back to school. 

Sarah's ambition is to carry on working with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, so that she can sustain her business and family. Thanks to the loans, she will earn enough to enable her children to continue their education. 

Sarah is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: to buy animal skins.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which were needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

Salvacion is very positive that she could further improve her business, if you will let her borrow another loan, in the amount of PHP 10,000. This new loan will go toward buying additional fruits and vegetables she needs to expand her product inventory. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Salvacion wants to have business expansion, so that she could continue to help provide for her family's everyday needs and expenses. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Myrzat

texts.ru: Мырзат, 27 лет, холост, детей нет. У Мырзат среднее образование. Уже 5 лет он занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход Мырзата составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма. Мырзат является участником группы "Батур", в которой кроме него состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Мырзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие его бизнеса.
texts.en: Myrzat is 27, unmarried, and has no children.  Myrzat has a secondary school education and has worked as a farmer for the past 5 years.  He currently has a dairy cow, a bull calf and two horses on his farm, and his monthly income is around 15,000 som.  For the future growth of his farm, he's requested a loan of 30,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy cows for fattening and resale.  Myrzat is a participant in the group "Batur", which includes two other people aside from himself.  He plans on putting his extra income due to the loan towards the future development of his business.

loans.use: buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 44 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Liezl requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Liezl has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Liezl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 39-year-old smallhold farmer based in Kericho, which is a small agricultural center near Kenya's famous Rift valley. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with beautiful children. 

They have been keeping a dairy, cattle, and poultry on their land for 10 years, as well growing vegetables. Their main income sources are milk, poultry, and crops. They recently ventured into a business transporting farm produce by motorcycle. 

Alfred is seeking from Kiva's lenders a 40,000 KES loan in order to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evidenced by the steady rise of exports. 

While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Alfred access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Alfred’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Joselin Milagros

texts.es:
La habilidad de brindar una buena atención, satisfacer las necesidades de los demás y una buena oratoria son aptitudes que se convierten en un arte. Joselin, es una joven de 24 años, que ha logrado afinar estas habilidades para que sean estas, parte de su desarrollo profesional. Ella estudia mercadotecnia y cursa el segundo año de la carrera. Su madre es de quien recibe mucho apoyo. 

Joselin solicita el crédito porque quiere comprar una computadora, la cual, usará como herramienta de trabajo para cumplir asignaciones de clases y de esta forma ser una estudiante aplicada. Las metas y planes de esta joven soñadora son culminar su carrera y llegar a tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
The ability to offer quality service, meet the expectations of others, and make a good presentation are skills that can be developed into an art. Joselin, a young woman of 24, has succeeded in refining these skills and folding them into her professional development. She studies marketing and is in the second year of her program. Her mother is her main source of support.

Joselin is taking out this loan because she wants to buy a computer, which she will use as a tool in completing her assignments and thus distinguish herself as a dedicated student. This young woman's goals and plans are to complete her education and succeed in having her own business.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Aysama

texts.en:
Aysama is a 32-year-old refugee. She is married, her husband is a labourer and earns a small amount of money for the family. They have lived in an IDP settlement for a long period. Aysama is a gardener, she keeps a small garden, there she raises fruits and sells them to neighbours or grocery sellers at the local bazaar. This is very hard job for a woman. She has worked in this area for 10 years and has good skills, but earns only 159 AZN monthly.

Aysama loves gardening and knows that this is the only way to get income for her family. The family is poor and needs to cover their demands somehow. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy a grocery shop so she can sell her harvest herself at the local bazaar together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a grocery shop so she can sell her harvest by herself.

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.en: Muminjon is a wise man. He is living in a small town. He is married. His wife is a teacher in university. He is studying for a second degree. His major is finance and credit. In 2011 he graduated university with a major in physics. Now he is studying for a second degree in order to have a new place of job. He wants to make a prospective career in the future. He is working in government. His duty is to accept an application from citizens who are asking for house (apartment) or place for dormitory. Muminjon is not earning enough money to pay university tuition. He needs financial support to pay university tuition.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, sheets, sand, and labour.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REYNA DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana  ella es casada y tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropala socia es una mujer emprendedora y por medio de este negocio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.


El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “REYNA DEL CARMEN” communal bank group. This bank is located in Cusco district, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member is Yovana. She is married, is 45 years old, and has 3 children. She works selling clothes. She is an enterprising woman and through this work wants her children to finish school. She sells pants, blouses, and shirts. She has been in this business for a number of years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a store. She asks for the loan to purchase shoes, shirts, sweaters, and blouses. 

The member who is attached to the group photo had his photo taken after the meeting because he asked permission due to work reasons. 

The other members work selling clothing, selling bricks, in a grocery store, and in a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Happy Ayllu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HAPPY AYLLU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha ella es casada y tiene 69 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labial y perfumes.
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo y los fotos son de uno de los prestamos anteriores. 
Se pega a mas de 4 personas porque los socios no asisten a la misma hora de la reunion porque no le das permiso en su trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de sabanas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "HAPPY AYLLU". This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, which is in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Bertha. She is 69 years old, is married, and has 4 children. The member works in her business selling beauty products. The member sells lipstick, lotions, and perfumes. The member wants to use this business to get ahead. The member is a strong and entrepreneurial woman. The member requests a loan to purchase lotions, lipstick, and perfumes.

The members in the thumbnail photos, that are added to the group photo, asked for permission for photos from previous loans to be used, for work-related reasons.

The other members make their living in the clothing sales business, bed sheet sales business, grocery store business, and beauty product sales business

loans.use: to purchase lotions, lipstick, and perfumes

loans.name: Edicta Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus hermosas playas, por su rica y variada gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo  De Crédito San Agustín Km 20.
En este lugar vive la señora Edicta, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de salud.
Doña Edicta es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro y más ahora que su marido está enfermo, ella en sociedad con sus hijos tienen un negocio de venta de camarón y otros mariscos, ellos viajan dos veces por semana a Ibarra, Quito y otras ciudades llevando estos productos en un pequeño camión que tienen para esto, ellos  entregan los productos al por mayor, son mas d 14 años con esta actividad la cual la  realizaba su marido pero al enfermarse el es ella con sus hijos los que la llevan adelante este negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar camarón y otros mariscos para llevar a sus clientes lo mejor. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The city Bahía De Caraquez is known for its beautiful beaches, its rich and varied cuisines, and the warmth of its people. The members of the Communal Bank named “San Agustín Km. 20” meet in this city every 15 days.

Sra. Edicta lives in this place. She is 53 years old, married, and has three grown children who are independent. Her husband does not work for health reasons.

Doña Edicta is a woman who has had to work very hard, but now she must work harder since her husband is ill. She and her children have a business selling shrimp and other shellfish. They travel twice a week to Ibarra, Quito, and other cities in a small truck with their products. Edicta and her children deliver their products in bulk. They have been in this business for more than 14 years. When her husband became ill, her children began helping her with keeping the business in operation.

This loan will be used to buy shrimp and other shellfish so that she can provide the best products for her customers. Edicta is a founding member of her Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped her to get ahead. Her dreams include continuing to move forward.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and other shellfish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley, 39, is a very nice man, tolerant and upright in his work. He is a smallholder farmer from Kaplamai village in the North Rift region of Kenya. Like most farmers in the region, Stanley practices mixed farming. He keeps dairy animals and grows maize among other crops. He has been doing this work for a decade now. Over the years, he has come to like farming because it is a sustainable and self-fulfilling investment. 

Farming doesn’t take all his time, so he is also able to attend to his side business of carrying passengers in his motorbike(boda boda). A delicate balance of both jobs has enabled him to comfortably raise his four children. Stanley is seeking a loan to purchase poultry and construct a chicken coop. He is ready to get into commercial production for meat, eggs and, perhaps, feathers. This business is very profitable but it doesn’t require a license, a big space or product marketing. There is an established market for poultry products in almost all places around the world. Besides, chickens will bring many non-monetary benefits to Stanley’s farm. Chickens will be great for his farm's compost because their poop is high in nitrogen; in free-range, they will naturally forage by scratching soil looking for bugs, which aerates the soil and breaks up vegetation for decomposition. 

Stanley will also use your money to construct a chicken coop in order to make the raising of chickens easier. By putting all the chickens in one place, he can feed them consistently, track each one of them easily and more easily manage and collect eggs and manure. The coop will contain water containers and laying boxes for the health, comfort and safety of the chickens. When Juhudi Kilimo’s loan officer asked Stanley how his family will benefit from the loan, he replied, “they will benefit from the income I get once I acquire the loan and buy the asset.”

loans.use: To purchase poultry and construct a chicken coop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 51 years old and married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eva has been farming rice for 12 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 23 times in the past to sustain her business. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Blessel Joy

texts.en:
Blessel Joy is 33 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig.

Blessel Joy has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from clothing sales. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to expand her business while continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Kour's Group

texts.en:
Kour is a 54-year-old, married woman, who lives with her family in a rural area located in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is still dependent on her. Kour earns a living through farming rice and raising ducks. She has been in this business for 34 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 58,000 KHR per day from the current business. They are able to save about 25,000 KHR each day, for the future.
 
This is the first loan for Kour from VisionFund. She is now leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Kour wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and feed for her ducks. She hopes to expand her business, and to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and duck feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is an older woman, but actually seems younger because of her ambition and inspiration.
She is the mother of eight children, which is a really big family. Salwa's husband was retired and now works as a driver. She noticed that her husband could not cover all of their household expenses, so she decided to work, breeding sheep and rabbits, as well as chicken and pigeons. This project began increasing their monthly income, which must be high, based on the needs of a such a large family.
 
Salwa wants to expand her business in order to increase her income and provide for her sons' needs, which increase day after day.
Salwa has asked for a loan to buy sheep, to increase the production of milk and dairy products.

loans.use: To buy sheep in order to increase her income and provide for her sons' needs

loans.name: Juan Lucilo

texts.es: Juan de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de embutidos de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes, pintándolas, encementando el piso y colocando cerámica, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de  cemento, arena, pintura, hierro, cerámica, pintura y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Juan is 60 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and child. He has been selling sausages as a street vendor in different neighborhoods for several years. With the income he earns from his sales, he is able to cover a few of his household expenses.

Juan wants to make improvements to his home by whitewashing the walls, painting it, laying down a concrete floor, and installing ceramic tiles. However, he does not have sufficient capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy cement, sand, paint, iron, and ceramic tiles, as well as pay for labor. As a result, Juan and his family can live in a more comfortable and cleaner environment.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, paint, iron, and ceramic tiles, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Monica Beatriz

texts.es: Mónica de 39 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella es empleada en una empresa pública desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y así ella y sus hijos puedan vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Mónica is 39 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her own home with her two children.

She has been working as an employee for a government-owned corporation for many years now. This is how she has managed to provide for her two children.

She wants to improve her home by building a room in the place shown in the photograph. However, she doesn't make enough money to do so. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to pay for labor and to purchase cement, sand, brick, rebar, metal sheeting, and purlins. In this way, she and her children will be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase cement, sand, bricks, rebar, metal sheeting, and purlins.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 37, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Elmer, a machine operator, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, they manage their own household while she operates their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates a printing business. She mainly offers signboards, sticker boards, tarpaulins, and other printed materials used in businesses, schools, and others of the like. She buys the materials and supplies for printing and manufactures different printed materials that her customers require. Her regular customers are business owners, students, and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help Edna continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy supplies and materials and to pay for equipment maintenance.

Edna dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies and to pay for the maintenance of her printing business equipment.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 43 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in the Philippines and earns a living by raising pigs. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, as well as feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Ofelia has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, as well as feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a 49-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Felomina has been in this business for five years. Her future goal is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Dianela

texts.en:
Dianela is 66 years old and married.

Dianela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Dianela requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dianela has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dianela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. Luzviminda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Luzviminda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 9 years now, and also earns additional income.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Bonita

texts.en:
Bonita is 43 years old and has seven children.  Bonita is married and all of her children are currently in school.

Bonita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Bonita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bonita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bonita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nory is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines. Nory requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nory has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Nory would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay his education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for new products and a new coffee machine to increase his income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for higher education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and tools to improve her restaurant

loans.name: Ilda Rubenia

texts.es:
Ilda, de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casada, tiene 7 hijos, 3 de ellos estudian y los demás hijos se dedican a ayudar a sus padres, en la agricultura. 

Ilda, es una mujer muy trabajadora al igual que su esposo, ellos se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos.

Ilda, necesita el préstamo para reparar el techo de su casa, ya que hay mucha madera que necesita ser cambiada, también algunas tejas están quebradas; con la reparación dará mayor seguridad  a su familia.

Ilda, tiene pensado en un futuro poder  ampliar más el espacio en donde tiene la cocina para tener almacenados los granos básicos de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Ilda is 39 years old and studied through the third grade. She is married and has seven children, three of whom are studying while the others help her and her husband with the farming.

Ilda and her husband are extremely hardworking people. They grow basic grains. Ilda needs a loan so that she can repair the roof of her house. Much of the wood needs to be replaced and a few tiles are broken. Repairing the roof would provide greater security for her family.

In the future, Ilda plans to expand the space where her kitchen is located so that there will be a place for storing harvested grains.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Ang is 45 years old and married. She has three dependent children, all of whom are dependent and still in school. 

The primary source of her family’s income is from rice farming. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 27 years, Ang can earn about USD 8 per day and manage to save about USD 3. The main challenge to her family’s business is unhealthy rice crops. 

This is Ang's first loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland and to use a portion to buy a pig to raise. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland and to buy a pig.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Saven

texts.en:
Originally from a village in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey Stoeng district, Saven is 36 years old, and married with three dependent children, who are still in school. For more than 17 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income, and they can earn about 36,000 KHR per day. They manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 
This is Saven’s first loan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy rice seeds for her farmland, and to pay for labor fees. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland and increase her rice farming production. This will enable her to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and to pay for labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Guadalupe (seated left in the photo, accompanied by one of her clients on the right) is 57 years old, a widow and mother of three. None of her children are economically dependent on her. She lives in a house she owns and has been involved in commerce for 13 years; she enjoys her work. 

She makes a living selling catalog products such as footwear, clothes and cellphones. Additionally she is able to receive more income by working as a domestic helper in a house, occasionally cooking food to sell and she receives a monthly pension. 

Guadalupe asks for this loan to make some repairs to her house, specifically, she wants to invest in the roof of her house.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for notebooks, backpacks, shoes, and school enrollment and monthly expenses.
